Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-cultu.feature: In Korean culture, indirect communication is preferred over direct expression to maintain harmonious relationships between speakers and listeners, prioritizing politeness and emotional tone over literal meaning.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-cultu.original:
- Quoted text "의사소통의 목표가 화자와 청자 사이의 관계를 보다 조화롭게 유지시키는 것이기에 고맥락 문화권에는 발화시점의 상황에 맞는 화자의 감성과 공손함이 문맥의 진실성이나 내용보다는 중시된다."  
  - Location p2===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/Detail/Ar?key=3745292

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-cultu.feature: Koreans rely on shared cultural context and non-verbal cues (such as situational awareness) rather than explicit verbal or written statements to understand meaning in communication.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-cultu.original:
- Quoted text "한국인의 의사소통 방식은 듣는 사람이 정확하게 받아들이게 하기 보다는 공통적인 문화배경을 전제로 눈치껏 알아들을 수 있도록 하게하는 간접적인 방식을 선호한다."  
  - Location p2===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/Detail/Ar?key=3745292

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-cultu.feature: Understanding the underlying intentions behind someone's words is crucial in Korean communication, requiring individuals to use "nunchi" (situational awareness) to interpret unspoken meanings regardless of surface-level expressions.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-cultu.original:
- Quoted text "한국 언어문화 속에서는 상대방의 표면적인 말이 어떠하든지 간에 눈치로 상황을 읽어 내고 그 내면의 의미를 판단하는 것이 매우 중요하다."  
  - Location p3===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/Detail/Ar?key=3745292

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-cultu.feature: Koreans tend not to verbally express emotions such as apology, gratitude, or love directly, due to the cultural emphasis on situational feelings and relational sensitivity over spoken words.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-cultu.original:
- Quoted text "한국인이 사과나 감사, 그리고 사랑의 표현을 잘 안 한다고 하는 것은 이러한 고맥락적인 특징에도 원인이 있다. 말보다는 상황적인 정서나 청자와 화자사이의 느낌을 중요하게 생각하기 때문이다."  
  - Location p3===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/Detail/Ar?key=3745292

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: A significant majority of South Korea's land area, specifically 70%, consists of mountainous regions.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "전 국토의 70%가 산지로 이루어져 있다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://dh.aks.ac.kr/Korea100/wiki/index.php/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98_%EC%A7%80%EB%A6%AC

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The cultural reference to "Changbai Mountain" in historical Chinese records does not consistently point to the current Mount Baekdu; instead, it was applied to various mountains in regions such as Huining (Heilongjiang) and Hadaling (Jilin) during the Jin, Yuan, and Ming dynasties.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "After examining historical records on Changbaishan (長白山), it has been determined that during the Jin dynasty, the Jurchen people worshipped and conducted rituals at a mountain referred to as Changbaishan, which was located in Huining, Heilongjiang Province."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/DetailOa/Ar?key=54586767

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The identification of Mount Baekdu as Changbai Mountain began only during the Qing Dynasty, particularly under Emperor Qianlong, indicating that this association is relatively recent rather than ancient.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "During the Qianlong era, the Qing dynasty began to refer to what is now Mount Baekdu as Changbaishan."
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/DetailOa/Ar?key=54586767

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Even during the Qing Dynasty, official maps and records maintained a distinction between Mount Baekdu and other mountains named Changbai in Jilin or Huining, showing that they were not considered the same entity at first.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "However, maps from that period still distinguish between Baekdu and the Changbaishan in the Jilin or Huining regions."
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/DetailOa/Ar?key=54586767

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The argument that Mount Baekdu has been part of a continuous "Changbai Mountain culture" since antiquity is not supported by substantial historical evidence, as earlier records associate Changbai with different locations.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "These findings suggest that the core argument of China’s Changbaishan cultural theory—that Mount Baekdu has been Changbaishan since ancient times—lacks substantial historical evidence."
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/DetailOa/Ar?key=54586767

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Korean folktales are used as effective educational tools in teaching Korean culture to international students because they are universally understandable, stimulate interest and imagination, and are commonly shared among Koreans from childhood.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "옛이야기는 학습자의 흥미와 상상력을 자극함으로써 학습 동기를 부여하고 외국인 학습자도 이해할 수 있는 보편성을 가지고 있어 다른 문학 텍스트에 비해 활용도가 높은 편이다. 또 한국인이면 어렸을 때부터 누구나 공유하는 콘텐츠라는 점에서 옛이야기는 한국어와 한국문화 교육에 효율적인 텍스트이다."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/Detail/Ar?key=4108024

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: The primary goal of using folktales in cultural education for international students is not the stories themselves but improving practical communication skills grounded in Korean culture for real-life application.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "외국인 유학생들이 요구하는 것도 ‘옛이야기’ 자체보다 ‘한국문화’에 기초한 의사소통능력 향상에 있다."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/Detail/Ar?key=4108024

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: To improve speaking abilities and encourage proactive, self-directed learning among international students, teaching methods such as flipped learning, Q&A sessions, storytelling, and role-playing are applied in Korean cultural education.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "플립러닝과 질의응답식 방법, 그리고 옛이야기의 스토리텔링과 역할극을 활용하면 외국인 유학생들의 말하기 능력을 향상시키고 적극적이고 자기 주도적인 대학 수학능력을 기대할 수 있다."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/Detail/Ar?key=4108024

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Children should be taught to eat with their right hand, as using the left hand is considered disobedient and disrespectful, reflecting a cultural norm rooted in Confucian values.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "“소학(小學)” 입교(立敎)에는 아이들이 밥을 먹게 되거든 오른손으로 먹는 것을 가르치라고 명시되어 있고, 이를 기준으로 한 식사 예절을 가르쳐 왔다. 가르침에 따르지 않았을 때는 왼손잡이가 되고, 이는 부모의 가르침을 따르지 않는 것이라 하여 불효라고 지탄을 받기도 했다."
  - Location p2===from https://www.her.re.kr/journal/view.php?viewtype=pubreader&number=4391

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Eating with the right hand is associated with strength and dignity, and is emphasized for both boys and girls as part of proper dining etiquette in traditional Korean culture.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "“성학집요(聖學輯要)” 3편 정가(正家), 교자(敎子)에도 이와 같은 바를 찾아볼 수 있다. “자식이 밥을 먹을 수 있게 되면 오른손으로 밥을 먹도록 가르쳐야 한다...식(食)은 밥(飯)이다. 사내아이나 계집아이나 모두 오른손으로 밥을 먹게 하는 것은 그 강함을 취한 것이다(p. 272)”
  - Location p2===from https://www.her.re.kr/journal/view.php?viewtype=pubreader&number=4391

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Important decisions are often not made during the meeting itself but are the result of prior agreements; meetings mainly serve to formalize already discussed outcomes.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "한국에서는 한 번의 회의로 모든 것을 결정하기보다는, 이미 어느 정도 합의된 결과를 공식화하는 성격이 강하다는 점을 기억하면 좋습니다."  
  - Location paragraph 6

- Rule Description Presenting information for the first time during the meeting can lead to conflict or strong opposition, so it is advisable to share key information with stakeholders in advance.  
- ===from http://mywebring.com/korean-meeting-culture-for-foreigners/

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: 김장은 가족과 마을 단위의 공동체가 함께 모여 김치를 대량으로 담그는 공동 작업으로, 공동체 문화와 밀접하게 관련되어 있다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "김장은 여러 사람이 함께 모여 많은 양의 김치를 담그기 때문에 한국의 공동체 문화와도 관련이 깊다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://kr.koreanculture.org/korea-information-culture

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: 김장은 여러 세대에 걸쳐 전승되는 나눔 문화를 상징하며, 개인주의가 강해진 현대 사회에서 한국인들의 연대감과 정체성을 유지하는 데 기여한다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "따라서 김장 문화는 개인주의 성향이 강해지고 있는 현대의 한국인들이 연대감을 강화하고 한국인으로서 정체성을 유지하게 한다는 점에서 의미가 있다. 여러 세대에 걸쳐 전승되어온 한국의 나눔 문화를 상징한다는 점에서도 의미가 깊다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://kr.koreanculture.org/korea-information-culture

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Traditional Korean houses (hanok) are designed to support communal living by serving as shared living spaces that integrate with nature and include heating and cooling systems for collective comfort.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "한옥은 인간과 자연이 공존하는 삶의 공간으로서 지어진다."  
  - Location p6===from http://www.livingindaejeon.or.kr/culturetraditions

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: In traditional Korean homes, rooms are not assigned fixed functions but are used flexibly for dining, sleeping, or other family activities depending on need, promoting shared use among household members.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "전통적인 한국인 가정의 방은 여러 가지 기능을 한다. 방마다 특정한 용도로 지정되지 않고 필요시에 테이블과 이불 등을 가져다 놓아 식당, 침실 등으로 사용한다."  
  - Location p7===from http://www.livingindaejeon.or.kr/culturetraditions

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Most Koreans live communally by sitting and sleeping together on the same heated floor (ondol), reinforcing group living within the household.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "대부분의 한국인들은 온돌방 바닥에 앉아 생활하거나 두꺼운 이불을 깔고 잠을 잔다."  
  - Location p7===from http://www.livingindaejeon.or.kr/culturetraditions

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: The family is regarded as the fundamental unit of society, and strong family relationships are essential to maintaining social harmony.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "가족 중심의 가치관은 유교의 핵심 중 하나로, 가족은 사회의 기초 단위로 간주됩니다."  
  - Location p5===from https://yuoong.com/entry/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98-%EC%9C%A0%EA%B5%90%EC%99%80-%EC%A0%84%ED%86%B5%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%98%88%EC%A0%88-%ED%9A%A8-%EA%B0%80%EC%A1%B1-%EC%A4%91%EC%8B%AC

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Family members have clearly defined roles and responsibilities, and they are expected to support and respect one another within the family structure.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "이를 통해 가족 구성원 간의 역할과 책임이 명확히 구분되었으며, 가족 내에서 서로를 지원하고 존중하는 문화가 발전했습니다."  
  - Location p5===from https://yuoong.com/entry/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98-%EC%9C%A0%EA%B5%90%EC%99%80-%EC%A0%84%ED%86%B5%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%98%88%EC%A0%88-%ED%9A%A8-%EA%B0%80%EC%A1%B1-%EC%A4%91%EC%8B%AC

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Families gather collectively during holidays to perform ancestral rites, reflecting a shared cultural practice centered on family unity and respect for ancestors.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "명절 때 온 가족이 모여 조상을 기리며 차례를 지내는 풍습, 부모님을 공경하는 관습 등은 유교적 전통의 연장선상에 있습니다."  
  - Location p5===from https://yuoong.com/entry/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98-%EC%9C%A0%EA%B5%90%EC%99%80-%EC%A0%84%ED%86%B5%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%98%88%EC%A0%88-%ED%9A%A8-%EA%B0%80%EC%A1%B1-%EC%A4%91%EC%8B%AC

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: In traditional Korean society, the primary responsibility for raising young children rested with mothers or grandmothers, especially during early childhood.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "전통시대에는 육아의 주된 책임이 어릴 때는 어머니나 할머니에게 있었으나, 자라면서 차차 아버지나 할아버지 등 성인 남성이 훈육을 담당하였다."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0042126

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: As children grew older, parental care and discipline responsibilities gradually shifted from female family members to adult males, such as fathers or grandfathers.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "전통시대에는 육아의 주된 책임이 어릴 때는 어머니나 할머니에게 있었으나, 자라면서 차차 아버지나 할아버지 등 성인 남성이 훈육을 담당하였다."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0042126

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Mothers were directly responsible for breastfeeding, while grandmothers often took over the process of weaning and feeding transitional foods.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "젖떼기[離乳] 먹이로는 미숫가루·밤죽·백무리·눌은밥 등이 있었으나, 주로 밥을 국이나 물에 말아서 먹이거나 죽을 먹였다. 또 젖을 떼기 위해 아기는 할머니와 함께 기거하고, 할머니가 빈 젖을 빨리며 키웠다."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0042126

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Grandmothers played a key role in managing both weaning and toilet training, using gentle and experienced-based methods rather than strict discipline.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "육아 경험이 풍부한 할머니가 젖떼기와 배변훈련을 담당했기 때문에 엄격한 훈련방법은 아니었다."
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0042126

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: In Korean culture, parental care is deeply tied to the moral obligation of filial piety, which is considered the foundation of all virtuous actions and is rooted in Confucian philosophy.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "유가 철학에서 효는 인(仁)을 실천하는 가장 기본적인 덕목으로서 백행의 근본으로 인식된다."
  - Location p1 (Research Summary section, under point ④)

---===from https://www.krm.or.kr/krmts/search/detailview/research.html?dbGubun=SD&category=Research&m201_id=10011871

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Parental care stems from the belief that a child’s body is inherited from parents, making the preservation of one’s body an essential act of filial duty and respect toward parents.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "한 개인의 몸은 부모라는 줄기에서 나온 가지이며, 따라서 몸과 머리카락, 피부는 모두 부모로부터 받은 것이므로 이들을 상하게 하지 않는 것이 효의 시작으로 본다(󰡔孝經󰡕 ｢開宗明義｣)."
  - Location p1 (Research Summary section, under point ②)

---===from https://www.krm.or.kr/krmts/search/detailview/research.html?dbGubun=SD&category=Research&m201_id=10011871

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: The relationship between parents and children is not isolated but forms part of an organic connection that extends from family to society and state, where caring for parents is linked to broader social and moral responsibilities.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "효제자(孝悌慈)는 개인의 몸과 부모의 몸을 하나로 묶는 것이며, 이것이 확장되어 개인의 몸과 가족 그리고 사회와 국가 간의 유기체적 설명을 이루는 근거가 된다."
  - Location p1 (Research Summary section, under point ②)

---===from https://www.krm.or.kr/krmts/search/detailview/research.html?dbGubun=SD&category=Research&m201_id=10011871

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Parental care includes both emotional reverence ("섬김의 마음") and active nurturing ("타자를 보살피는 마음"), and these should be mutual rather than unidirectional.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "효의 기본적 특성인 ‘섬김의 마음’과 ‘타자를 보살피는 마음’은 한쪽 방향으로만 진행되는 것이 아니라 두 가지 이상의 방향으로 이루어져야 한다."
  - Location p1 (Research Summary section, under point ⑤)

---===from https://www.krm.or.kr/krmts/search/detailview/research.html?dbGubun=SD&category=Research&m201_id=10011871

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Parental care and family relationships are not confined to private life but have strong public and political dimensions, influencing national policies and social welfare systems.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "현대 사회에서조차 효는 한 가정의 영역에 머물지 않고 많은 경우 국가 정책과 사회 복지의 차원과 연관되어 논의된다."
  - Location p1 (Research Summary section, under point ③)===from https://www.krm.or.kr/krmts/search/detailview/research.html?dbGubun=SD&category=Research&m201_id=10011871

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Parents practice self-care by managing their stress through physical activity, personal time, and social interactions to maintain their well-being while raising children.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "Both groups of parents indicated that they promoted “Self-cultivation” by releasing stress through exercising, having alone time, and meeting friends and neighbors."  
  - Location paragraph 1 (Results section, "Common practices on Korean traditional parenting virtues")===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12564-024-10032-z

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Parents view it as their duty to raise their children properly as responsible members of society.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "I think I have to raise him properly as a member of society because he is my child. … It's the responsibility as a parent."  
  - Location paragraph 2 (Results section, "Common practices on Korean traditional parenting virtues")===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12564-024-10032-z

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Parental care includes sacrificing personal resources such as sleep, time, money, and energy for the needs of their children.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "KS and ES parents reported practicing “Sacrifice” in similar. They reported that “Sacrifice” meant spending their time, money, and energy for their child."  
  - Location paragraph 3 (Results section, "Common practices on Korean traditional parenting virtues")===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12564-024-10032-z

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.feature: Parents demonstrate care by respecting their children’s autonomy and asking about their preferences before making decisions.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-famil.original:
- Quoted text "Though I want my child to do that, I ask her what she wants first. “What do you want?” Letting a child do what he or she wants."  
  - Location paragraph 4 (Results section, "Common practices on Korean traditional parenting virtues")===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12564-024-10032-z

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: There is a strong cultural awareness and resistance toward established authority or powerful groups, rooted in historical movements such as the independence and democratization movements.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "기득권이나 거대 집단에 대한 투철한 저항의식과, 정치와 사회 문제에 대한 자유로운 접근과 묘사도 대한민국 문화의 한 특징으로 독립 운동, 민주화 운동의 역사가 이를 방증하며..."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: Maintaining face (chemyon) is necessary for maintaining authority, but it does not guarantee the existence of authority; loss of face implies loss of authority.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "Maintenance of chemyon is a necessary but not a sufficient condition for the maintenance of authority. In other words, loss of chemyon implies the loss of authority and authority is preserved when one's chemyon is maintained."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.accesson.kr/kpacsi/v.6/1/69/26268

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: Authority-related behaviors in Korea are traditional, habitual, and morally charged cultural practices that are automatically accepted without critical reflection in social life.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "권위나 권위주의와 관련된 행동이 인습과 전통성을 가지며, 도덕적 성격을 띤 관행적 행동이라는 것은 일상적 삶이나 사회관계 속에서 비판적 의식의 개입없이 자연스럽게 나타나고 자동적으로 승인되는 문화맥락적 행위임을 뜻한다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.accesson.kr/kpacsi/v.6/1/69/26268

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: Authority and face mutually reinforce each other in a cyclical relationship—authority gives rise to face, and face supports the establishment of authority.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "즉, 권위에서 체면이 나오며 체면에서 권위가 세워진다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.accesson.kr/kpacsi/v.6/1/69/26268

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: Mothers play a central role in the socialization of their adolescent children, particularly influenced by Confucian values and modern expectations.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "This paper examines Korean mothers’ roles in the socialization of their adolescent children."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/BF03024935

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: The Confucian background continues to strongly influence Korean family life, shaping mothers' roles within the family.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "First, the issue is analyzed through a historical approach that takes into account the Confucian background of Korean family life."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/BF03024935

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: Mothers' responsibilities in parenting and socialization have increased in modern South Korea, despite ongoing Confucian influences.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "We point out that the Confucian influence remains strong in modern South Korea while at the same time mothers responsibilities in parenting and socialization have increased."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/BF03024935

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: The relationship between mothers and their adolescent children has become more complex, intense, and unstable due to evolving societal demands.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "As a consequence, the relationship between mothers and their adolescent children has become more complex, intense, and unstable."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/BF03024935

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: A major developmental challenge for mothers and their adolescent children is balancing personal autonomy with family-relatedness.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "We conclude that the balancing of autonomy and relatedness is the most important developmental task facing mothers and their children."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/BF03024935

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: In patriarchal families, women bear the primary responsibility for carrying out practical duties related to elder care, and the Confucian virtue of filial piety can function as an oppressive moral obligation specifically imposed on women.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "효가 자발적으로 수행되는 것처럼 보이지만 사실 그 안에는 도덕적 강박관념이 깊게 작용한다는 것과 노인 봉양의 의무와 관련한 실무를 직접적으로 수행하고 있는 가부장적 가족 내에서 효가 여성에게 억압적인 덕목으로 작용할 수 있음을 비판적으로 검토함으로써 효를 여성주의 보살핌의 윤리로 만들 수 있는 가능성을 타진한다."
  - Location p2 (Results Summary section)===from https://www.krm.or.kr/krmts/search/detailview/research.html?dbGubun=SD&category=Research&m201_id=10011871

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: The actual practice of caregiving within the family, particularly under the concept of filial piety, is predominantly carried out by women in patriarchal family structures, even though the moral expectation is framed as a general virtue.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "노인 봉양의 의무와 관련한 실무를 직접적으로 수행하고 있는 가부장적 가족 내에서 효가 여성에게 억압적인 덕목으로 작용할 수 있음을 비판적으로 검토함"
  - Location p2 (Results Summary section)===from https://www.krm.or.kr/krmts/search/detailview/research.html?dbGubun=SD&category=Research&m201_id=10011871

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: Educated women were initially seen as ideal housewives who held full authority and initiative within the family after marriage.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "At first, educated women were called them housewives when they had all the initiative in the family after they got married."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/406564

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: By the late 1930s, the role of the housewife became equated with that of a daughter-in-law, and actual family authority shifted to the mother-in-law due to younger generations’ inability to form independent households.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "Since the late 1930s, ‘housewife’ has become the same meaning as ‘daughter-in-law.’ Now the owners of the family were not newly married housewives but mother-in-law. This is because the younger generation could not make independent families even if they were married."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/406564

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: The primary roles expected of housewives within the family were domestic labor and shopping, with increasing expectations for efficiency and rationalization in household management.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "The most important task for educated housewives was efficient housework."  
  - Quoted text "The new duty entrusted to the housewife was to shop."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/406564

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: Housewives gained new authority through control over household economics and consumption, including budgeting, planning, and participating in consumer unions to influence both family and national economies.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "Housewives now know how to save and plan for consumption of planning. And they learned how to purchase goods reasonably and economically through consumer unions. This was the greatest authority given to a housewife. Housewives have become influential not only in the domestic economy but also in the real economy of Joseon through consumption and solidarity."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/406564

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.feature: In Korean social interactions, the appropriate response to an empty compliment varies depending on the context and the relationship between speaker and listener; acceptance is common in ritual greetings and conversation continuation, while deflection is typical when the compliment is elicited, and rejection or acceptance may alternate in situations involving encouragement or mitigation.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-house.original:
- Quoted text "The analysis showed that in the contexts of ritual greeting (A) and conversation continuation (B), 'acceptance' responses were predominant. In elicited compliment (C), 'deflection' was most frequently chosen, and in encouragement/situation mitigation (D), 'acceptance' and 'rejection' alternated depending on the speaker listener relationship."
  - Location paragraph 6

No other cultural rules regarding “social interaction” are explicitly stated in the text. All other content pertains to literary analysis, educational materials, historical perceptions, or religious representation, without specifying social interaction norms.===from http://jkcjournal.korea.ac.kr/

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Male dominance is institutionalized through cultural norms that equate masculinity with power and view women and queer individuals as inferior, reinforcing male superiority.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "가부장제 사회에서 ‘남성’은 ‘보편’이자 유일한 ‘인간’이다. 남성성은 여성성을 비하함으로써 성립된다."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://pedia.watcha.com/ko-KR/contents/byZkvPK

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Expressions like “계집애 같다” or “너 게이냐?” are used among men as insults, reflecting the cultural assumption that being like a woman or queer person signifies inferiority and lack of proper masculinity.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "“계집애 같다” “너 게이냐?” 같은 말이 남자들 사이에서 욕으로 쓰이는 것은 여성이나 퀴어가 남성성이 없거나 부족한, 열등한 존재로 여겨지기 때문이다."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://pedia.watcha.com/ko-KR/contents/byZkvPK

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Traditional male dominance includes the expectation that men should be sole providers for the family, a role tied to patriarchal authority, even though this is increasingly unattainable in modern Korean society.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "혼자 가정을 책임지는 가부장이 될 수 없는 상황에서 많은 젊은 남자들이 역차별의 억울함을 호소하거나 ‘일베’나 남초 커뮤니티에서 사이버 마초로 변신해 현실과 멀어지고 있다."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://pedia.watcha.com/ko-KR/contents/byZkvPK

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Even as traditional male roles such as breadwinning become unfeasible, men still expect to retain their dominant social status, reflecting an ongoing cultural entitlement tied to male dominance.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "남자들은 사회가 원하는 성 역할을 할 수 없게 되었지만, 여전히 남성으로서 지위를 유지하고 있다."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://pedia.watcha.com/ko-KR/contents/byZkvPK

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Masculinity in Korean society is defined by adherence to socially and culturally formed male-dominated standards.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "The definition of masculinity was to conform to the male-dominated standard formed socially and culturally."
  - Location paragraph 2 (Abstract)===from https://scienceon.kisti.re.kr/srch/selectPORSrchArticle.do?cn=JAKO201918852935510

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 남성이 사회에서 인간의 보편으로 간주되며, 여성은 특수한 존재로 여겨진다. 남성은 성별을 드러내는 이름 없이 시민, 노동자 등으로 불리는 반면, 여성은 ‘여비서’, ‘여교사’처럼 성별을 강조하는 명칭으로 불린다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "인류 역사상 남성은 언제나 인간 보편이자 ‘일반’이었고 여성은 항상 보편의 ‘특수’로 존재해 왔다. 여성은 ‘여비서’ ‘여교사’ ‘여기자’처럼 ‘여성’이라는 특수의 위치를 드러내는 이름으로 불리지만, 남성은 노동자, 시민, 유권자, 청년으로 불리며 보편을 대표해 왔다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://ebook-product.kyobobook.co.kr/dig/epd/ebook/E000005293254

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 남성성은 여성성을 비하함으로써 성립하며, “계집애 같다” 또는 “너 게이냐?” 같은 표현이 남성 사이에서 욕으로 사용되는 것은 여성이나 퀴어를 열등한 존재로 간주하기 때문이다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "가부장제 사회에서 ‘남성’은 ‘보편’이자 유일한 ‘인간’이다. 남성성은 여성성을 비하함으로써 성립된다. “계집애 같다” “너 게이냐?” 같은 말이 남자들 사이에서 욕으로 쓰이는 것은 여성이나 퀴어가 남성성이 없거나 부족한, 열등한 존재로 여겨지기 때문이다."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://ebook-product.kyobobook.co.kr/dig/epd/ebook/E000005293254

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 진정한 남자로 인정받기 위해서는 남자다운 몸, 성격, 능력을 갖추어야 한다는 사회적 규범이 존재한다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "진정한 남자로 인정받으려면 남자다운 몸, 남자다운 성격, 남자다운 능력을 갖추어야 한다."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://ebook-product.kyobobook.co.kr/dig/epd/ebook/E000005293254

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 남성 집단 내에서는 자위 경험 공유, 성적 능력 과시, 여성의 대상화가 남성성을 재사회화하고 집단을 결속시키는 수단으로 작용한다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "자위 경험 공유, 성적 능력 과시, 여성의 대상화 등은 남성 집단을 끈끈하게 유지하는 중요한 요소이다."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://ebook-product.kyobobook.co.kr/dig/epd/ebook/E000005293254

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 한국 남성은 외부의 강대국(예 미국)과의 관계에서 자신을 피해자로 인식하면서도, 그 불만을 자국 여성에게 전가함으로써 식민지 남성성을 형성한다. 이는 자신이 한국 여성에 대한 성폭력이나 구타를 통해 자존심의 상처를 회복하려는 방식으로 나타난다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "한국 남성은 역사상 한 번도 외세와의 관계에서 한국 여성을 보호한 적이 없다. 더 중요한 문제는 자신이 소유한 여자를 적에게 빼앗긴 자존심의 상처를 다시 한국 여성에 대한 성폭력이나 구타로 해결하려는 것이다."
  - Location paragraph 15===from https://product.kyobobook.co.kr/detail/S000001896786

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 한국 사회에서 남성성은 여성이나 퀴어를 열등한 존재로 간주함으로써 유지되며, “계집애 같다” 또는 “너 게이냐?”라는 표현이 남성 사이에서 욕으로 사용되는 것은 여성성과 퀴어를 하위로 보는 문화를 반영한다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "가부장제 사회에서 ‘남성’은 ‘보편’이자 유일한 ‘인간’이다. 남성성은 여성성을 비하함으로써 성립된다. “계집애 같다” “너 게이냐?” 같은 말이 남자들 사이에서 욕으로 쓰이는 것은 여성이나 퀴어가 남성성이 없거나 부족한, 열등한 존재로 여겨지기 때문이다."
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://product.kyobobook.co.kr/detail/S000001896786

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 한국의 박정희 군사 정권 시기에 남성성은 군대를 통한 국민 관리 제도와 징병 검사를 통해 형성되었으며, 이 과정에서 특정한 신체 조건을 충족하는 남성만이 진정한 남성으로 인정받았다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "(박정희 군사 정권) 체제의 또 다른 주요 목적은 남성성 관리였다. 군인인 남성을 만들기 위한 기획의 일환으로 주민 등록 제도를 시행하지만 이것만으로 충분하지 않다. 구체적으로 어떤 몸을 군인으로 승인할 것인지가 중요하다."
  - Location paragraph 20===from https://product.kyobobook.co.kr/detail/S000001896786

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 남성들이 집단 내에서 유대를 형성할 때 자위 경험 공유, 성적 능력 과시, 여성의 대상화 등의 행동을 통해 남성성을 재생산하며, 이러한 행위는 실제로 발생하지 않은 일도 과장하여 말하는 경우가 많다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "자위 경험 공유, 성적 능력 과시, 여성의 대상화 등은 남성 집단을 끈끈하게 유지하는 중요한 요소이다. 남성끼리 나누는 ‘몇 명과 자봤다’, ‘하룻밤에 몇 번을 사정했다’, ‘내 물건은 크고 굵어서 상대 여자가 힘들어 죽는다’ 따위의 말 상당수가 실제로는 일어나지 않은 일이지만 그럴듯한 말로 포장된다."
  - Location paragraph 29===from https://product.kyobobook.co.kr/detail/S000001896786

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 한국 사회에서 사회 규범은 제3자에 의한 공식적인 처벌이 아닌, 공동체 구성원 스스로가 위반자를 처벌함으로써 유지된다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "사회 규범의 처벌은 공동체 구성원 스스로가 담당하는 ‘자체 집행(self-enforcement)’이 된다."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0026126

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 사회 규범이 효과적으로 작동하기 위해서는 구성원 간의 사회적 관계가 촘촘하고 폐쇄적이어야 하며, 이러한 구조가 처벌의 실효성을 보장한다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "해당 공동체가 작고 폐쇄적이어야 함을 의미한다. 즉 사회적 연결망의 촘촘하고 닫힌 정도(‘closure of network’; Coleman, 1990 275)가 처벌의 실효성과 함께 사회 규범의 효과를 담보한다."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0026126

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: 한국 문화에서 사회 규범은 단순한 조정 수단이 아니라, '해야 한다' 또는 '해서는 안 된다'는 강제적 압박을 내포하며 개인의 이기적 행동을 억제하는 역할을 한다.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "즉 규범은 행위들의 단순한 상호 조정(coordination) 차원을 넘어서서 구성원에게 ‘~을 하라’ 혹은 ‘~을 하지 말아라’ 식의 강제적인 압박을 갖는다."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0026126

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: South Korea has made progress toward gender egalitarianism, particularly in education and support for working mothers maintaining relationships with children, but traditional beliefs about women's domestic roles persist, especially regarding the negative impact of full-time work on family life and preschool children.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "The results suggest progress towards gender egalitarianism in Korea, yet also highlight the persistence of traditional beliefs regarding women's domestic roles."
  - Location paragraph 1 (Abstract)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: A growing majority of respondents believe that a working mother can maintain a warm and secure relationship with her child, indicating increasing acceptance of maternal employment.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "Regarding the statement about a working mother’s relationship with her children, a larger proportion of respondents either strongly agreed or agreed with the idea of compatibility between work and motherhood. In 2003, approximately 62% of survey respondents agreed, and this percentage increased to 67% in 2012 and to 71% in 2016."
  - Location paragraph 8 (3.1 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Despite growing support for working mothers, a majority of respondents still believe that a mother’s employment negatively affects her preschool child.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "For the statement asking whether a mother’s work negatively impacts her preschool child, the percentage of respondents who agreed decreased from 73% in 2003 to 68% 2012. However, a majority of respondents still believed that a preschool child is likely to suffer if their mother works."
  - Location paragraph 8 (3.1 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: There has been a decreasing trend in the belief that women’s full-time employment harms family life, though nearly half of respondents still agree with this view.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "The proportion of people who either strongly or agreed with the statement decreased by 18% from 2003 to 2016. In 2016, about 46% of respondents agreed with the statement regarding the negative influence of women’s full-time work on family life."
  - Location paragraph 8 (3.1 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Most Koreans support the idea that both men and women should contribute to household income, and this attitude has remained stable over time.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "Most respondents, nearly 70%, agreed that both man and woman should contribute to the household income in both 2003 and 2012... This is the only item that did not change over time."
  - Location paragraph 8 (3.1 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: There has been a significant increase in the number of people who reject the male breadwinner and female homemaker family model.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "Proportions of people who strongly disagreed with the male breadwinner family model considerably increased from 11 to 17%. Only about 34% of the respondents agreed with the notion of male breadwinner family model."
  - Location paragraph 8 (3.1 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: While supporting working mothers emotionally, many Koreans still believe it is ideal for mothers to work part-time to prioritize family responsibilities.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "Overall, the gender-role attitudes concerning a mother’s work... suggest that while a working mother can establish a warm relationship with her children, it is considered ideal for her to have a part-time job to prioritize her family responsibilities."
  - Location paragraph 9 (3.2 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes by Gender)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Younger birth cohorts are significantly more supportive of working mothers maintaining good relationships with their children compared to older generations.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "The percentages of respondents who agreed with the statement about a working mother’s relationship with her children are higher among younger birth cohorts. Only 52% of the 1910–1940 cohort agreed with the statement, while 80% of the youngest birth cohort (1991–2000) expressed agreement."
  - Location paragraph 10 (3.3 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes by Birth Cohort)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Younger generations are less likely to agree with the traditional view that a woman’s primary desire is for a home and children, with most younger cohorts disagreeing with this statement.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "While the majority of older cohorts agreed with the statement, the majority of younger cohorts disagreed. Approximately 20% of respondents, except for the 1941–1950 birth cohort, held neutral opinions on this item."
  - Location paragraph 10 (3.3 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes by Birth Cohort)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Individuals with the highest household income are more likely to hold egalitarian gender-role attitudes, particularly regarding women’s full-time work and opposition to the male breadwinner model.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "In contrast, respondents with the highest household income were more likely to hold egalitarian attitudes toward women’s full-time work and its consequences for family."
  - Location paragraph 11 (3.4 Socio-Demographic Correlates of Gender-Role Attitudes)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Highly educated individuals (bachelor’s degree or above) are less likely to support dual-earner couples but more likely to oppose the male breadwinner model, showing a nuanced relationship between education and gender-role attitudes.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "Highly educated people, including those with junior college education or a bachelor’s degree or above, were less likely to report egalitarian attitudes toward dual earner couples compared to those with lower levels of education... In contrast to the model with the dual incomes item, education was positively associated with gender-role attitudes concerning the male breadwinner role. Individuals with a bachelor’s degree or above were more likely to hold egalitarian gender-role attitudes compared to those with lower levels of education."
  - Location paragraph 12 (Table 5 discussion in 3.4)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Women are more likely than men to support egalitarian views on dual-income households and to oppose the male breadwinner model.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "Women were more likely than men to hold egalitarian gender-role attitudes... Regarding attitudes toward the male breadwinner role, women were more likely than men to hold egalitarian attitudes, consistent with the findings for attitudes toward dual incomes."
  - Location paragraph 12 (Table 5 discussion in 3.4)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: A majority of respondents across all years believe that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as paid work, with little change over time.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "Throughout the years 2003 to 2006, the majority of respondents either strongly agreed or agreed that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay. Over 80% of respondents expressed this view..."
  - Location paragraph 8 (3.1 Trends in Gender-Role Attitudes)===from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-99-5829-0_4

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Women are increasingly expected to balance dual roles as both caregivers and breadwinners, with state policies structurally reinforcing the assignment of care and reproductive responsibilities to women.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "However, Korea is using it [work-life balance] to absorb female workers as performers of dual roles of care and livelihood, structurally shifting the responsibility for care and reproduction onto women."  
  - Location paragraph 1  

- Rule Description Work-life balance policies in Korea have been limited by patriarchal capitalism and the ideology of the “normal family,” which reinforce gender inequality and place a disproportionate burden of care work on women.  
- ===from https://www.earticle.net/Public/Articles/5/1877/3292

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Traditional folk tales, such as those collected by the Brothers Grimm and Perrault, intentionally portrayed women as repressed under patriarchal structures, where female desires and curiosity were depicted as taboo elements, unlike male counterparts.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "그림형제와 페로가 수집하여 기록한 옛 이야기는 가부장제에 억압된 여성상을 의도적으로 제시해왔다. 여성의 모험담은 남성의 모험담과 달리 유형화된 서사구조를 따르고 있으며, 여성의 욕망과 호기심은 남성의 그것과 달리 금기시되는 화소로 사용되었다."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://scienceon.kisti.re.kr/srch/selectPORSrchArticle.do?cn=DIKO0014021281

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Animations based on traditional stories attempted to present new female characters but mostly failed to fully escape from existing gender stereotypes, resulting in only limited portrayals of empowered women.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "옛 이야기를 원작으로 한 애니메이션의 경우 이러한 과거의 틀을 벗어나려 시도하는 여성상을 제시하기도 했지만 대부분 기존의 고정관념을 탈피하지 못한 제한적 여성상을 묘사하는데 그쳤다."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://scienceon.kisti.re.kr/srch/selectPORSrchArticle.do?cn=DIKO0014021281

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Modern films based on folk tales have introduced more diverse and individualized female characters who actively break free from patriarchal constraints, seek self-identity, and maturely confront adversaries, showing significant development from passive traditional roles.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "옛 이야기를 원천으로 하여 제작된 영화는 다양한 개성을 지닌 여성상을 탄생시켰다는 점에서 주목할 만하다... 주인공 여성상은 기존의 가부장적 틀을 깨고 나와 자신의 자아를 찾고자 노력하는 적극적 모습을 보이기도 한다. 특히 영화에 등장하는 여주인공은 옛 이야기 속 수동적인 모습과 달리 악녀인 적수와 동등하게 대적할 만큼 성숙하였다."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://scienceon.kisti.re.kr/srch/selectPORSrchArticle.do?cn=DIKO0014021281

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Female antagonists such as witches and stepmothers, once depicted as unattractive and irrationally ill-tempered, are now given narrative justification and realistic, relatable traits in modern films, evoking audience sympathy.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "주인공의 적수 역할을 하는 마녀와 계모의 변화양상은 특히 주목할 만했다. 과거에는 못생기고 이유 없이 괴팍한 성질을 지닌 것으로 묘사됐던 이들 여성상은 영화 속에서 서사구조상의 타당성을 획득한다. 한층 현실적이고 친숙한 모습으로 변화하여 관객들의 동정심을 불러일으키기도 한다."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://scienceon.kisti.re.kr/srch/selectPORSrchArticle.do?cn=DIKO0014021281

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Recent cultural content retains traditional names and settings from old tales but diversifies female characters’ personalities and behaviors, reflecting contemporary societal expectations of women.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "최근의 문화콘텐츠 속 여성상은 이름과 시대적 배경은 옛 이야기의 것을 그대로 유지하면서 성격과 행동양상에 있어서는 다양하게 변화하는 모습을 보여 왔다."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://scienceon.kisti.re.kr/srch/selectPORSrchArticle.do?cn=DIKO0014021281

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Women perceive gender conflicts as being caused by discrimination against women and disparities in social and economic status between genders.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "women identified factors such as discrimination and differences in social and economic status"  
  - Location p2===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/DetailOa/Ar?key=54560899

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Men view the improvement of women’s rights and status as a contributing factor to gender conflicts.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "men pointed to the improvement of women’s rights and status"  
  - Location p2===from https://kiss.kstudy.com/DetailOa/Ar?key=54560899

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Gender equality awareness has spread in South Korea, and numerous policies have been implemented to address gender inequality, but the society is still not considered fully gender-equal.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "Although the awareness of gender equality is spreading and many policies are being implemented to resolve gender inequality, no one would consider Korean society as gender equality society."  
  - Location paragraph 3

- Rule Description Traditional gender policies focused primarily on women, but there is now a shift toward developing gender equality policies that actively include men.  
- ===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/1318468

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Younger generations, particularly 20-30 year-old women, are increasingly embracing feminist values and advocating for gender equality in education, employment, and personal rights, challenging traditional gender roles.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text "The movement was led by women in their 20s and 30s who strongly believed they were not inferior to men in terms of education or ability, had high expectations for equality, but experienced discrimination in hiring, wages, promotions, and exposure to various forms of sexual violence including digital sexual exploitation."  
  - Location paragraph 4  

- Rule Description Some young men perceive themselves as victims of reverse discrimination due to gender-based policies and societal changes, leading to resistance against feminism and the formation of anti-feminist sentiment despite being part of a generation imagined to hold more open and flexible gender attitudes.  
- ===from https://www.keaf.org/book/EAF_Policy_Debates/Making_Sense_of_the_Gender_Debate_in_South_Korea

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: In the Korean arts and culture sector, older individuals—particularly men—leverage age-based hierarchies to exert power over younger artists, especially women, which contributes to gendered power imbalances and enables sexual abuse.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text “As a minor, I was sexually abused by a poet at least 20 years older than me.”
  - Location paragraph 1 (Note 1)===from https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10286632.2024.2306132

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Within the Korean cultural sector, particularly in acting, there is a justification of sexual violence under the guise of achieving "authentic" artistic performance, where victims are pressured to endure sexual remarks or physical acts as part of their professional development.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text “Offenders justified their conduct, saying that the basic instincts and sexual desires are sublimated through art.”
  - Location paragraph 1 (Note 2)===from https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10286632.2024.2306132

Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.feature: Female artists in Korea are frequently subjected to objectification and bodily intrusion—such as being required to undergo nude photography or even forced penetration—under institutionalized practices like “Body Confirm,” reflecting entrenched gender inequality in cultural work.
Social_Relationship_and_Structures-gende.original:
- Quoted text “Many female actors are constantly requested to have their naked bodies photographed or rated in the name of ‘Body Confirm’ or even forced to go through actual penetration at the shooting despite their rejection.”
  - Location paragraph 1 (Note 2)===from https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10286632.2024.2306132

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: Korean collectivism has evolved into a "selective collectivism," where individuals form tighter, self-chosen groups rather than relying on traditionally given groups such as family or community.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "First, the collectivism of Koreans is defined as 'selective collectivism', which is based on a more compact group consisting of self-selected members rather than a given group as before."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://koreascience.kr/article/JAKO202003562711118.page

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: A new form of collectivism has emerged in online spaces, characterized by horizontal relationships, anonymity, and constant connectivity across time and space, contrasting with traditional offline collectivism.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "Second, with the development of technology, online collectivism, in contrast to offline collectivism, emerged. Online collectivism is based on communication using online technology, and is characterized by horizontal relationship based on anonymity and 24-hour connectivity that transcends time and space."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://koreascience.kr/article/JAKO202003562711118.page

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: 'Cheong' remains a fundamental and unchanged component of Korean collectivism, serving as a key emotional and relational factor within group dynamics.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "Third, the most important factor that composes Korean collectivism was found to be 'Cheong', which was recognized as an unchanged aspect of collectivism."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://koreascience.kr/article/JAKO202003562711118.page

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: For Koreans, group affiliation is deeply tied to personal identity, leading to a persistent emphasis on belonging and maintaining relationships within the group.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "Lastly, for Koreans, the group is closely related to self-identity, and for this reason, Koreans are obsessed with the sense of belonging to the group membership and the relationship with the members."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://koreascience.kr/article/JAKO202003562711118.page

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: 개인은 집단의 일부로 간주되며, 자신의 역할과 책임을 통해 집단에 기여하고 집단의 이익을 위해 행동해야 한다.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "집단 이기주의에서는 집단이 개인보다 더 중요하며, 개인은 집단의 일부로 간주됩니다. 개인은 자신의 역할과 책임을 통해 집단에 기여하고 집단의 이익을 위해 행동해야 한다고 여깁니다."
  - Location p2===from https://istor-y.tistory.com/entry/%EC%A7%91%EB%8B%A8-%EC%9D%B4%EA%B8%B0%EC%A3%BC%EC%9D%98-Collectivism-%EA%B0%9C%EB%85%90%EA%B3%BC-%EC%9D%98%EB%AF%B8

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: 집단 구성원들은 공동의 목표를 달성하기 위해 협력하고 서로 도움을 주며, 개인적인 이익보다 집단의 이익을 우선시한다.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "집단 이기주의 사회에서는 협력과 공동 작업이 강조됩니다. 집단 구성원들은 공동의 목표를 달성하기 위해 협력하고 서로 도움을 주며, 개인적인 이익보다 집단의 이익을 추구합니다."
  - Location p3===from https://istor-y.tistory.com/entry/%EC%A7%91%EB%8B%A8-%EC%9D%B4%EA%B8%B0%EC%A3%BC%EC%9D%98-Collectivism-%EA%B0%9C%EB%85%90%EA%B3%BC-%EC%9D%98%EB%AF%B8

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: 가족, 친구, 지역사회 등의 사회적 관계가 개인과 집단 간의 유대감을 형성하는 데 기여한다.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "집단 이기주의 문화에서는 사회적인 결속이 강화됩니다. 가족, 친구, 지역사회 등 다양한 사회적 관계가 개인과 집단 간의 유대감을 형성하는 데 기여합니다."
  - Location p4===from https://istor-y.tistory.com/entry/%EC%A7%91%EB%8B%A8-%EC%9D%B4%EA%B8%B0%EC%A3%BC%EC%9D%98-Collectivism-%EA%B0%9C%EB%85%90%EA%B3%BC-%EC%9D%98%EB%AF%B8

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: 집단 내부의 규범과 가치가 중시되며, 구성원들은 집단의 규칙과 도덕적 가치를 준수해야 한다.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "집단 이기주의에서는 집단 내부의 규범과 가치가 강조됩니다. 집단은 자체적인 규칙과 도덕적 가치를 가지며, 구성원들은 이를 준수해야 합니다."
  - Location p5===from https://istor-y.tistory.com/entry/%EC%A7%91%EB%8B%A8-%EC%9D%B4%EA%B8%B0%EC%A3%BC%EC%9D%98-Collectivism-%EA%B0%9C%EB%85%90%EA%B3%BC-%EC%9D%98%EB%AF%B8

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: 한국을 포함한 동아시아 문화권에서는 가족, 조직, 국가 등 다양한 집단에서 단결과 안정성이 중시되며, 집단의 이익이 우선시된다.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "동아시아 문화(예 중국, 일본, 한국)에서는 집단 이기주의가 강조됩니다. 가족, 조직, 국가 등 다양한 집단에서 집단의 단결과 안정성을 중요시하며, 집단의 이익을 우선시합니다."
  - Location p6===from https://istor-y.tistory.com/entry/%EC%A7%91%EB%8B%A8-%EC%9D%B4%EA%B8%B0%EC%A3%BC%EC%9D%98-Collectivism-%EA%B0%9C%EB%85%90%EA%B3%BC-%EC%9D%98%EB%AF%B8

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: South Korean society maintains a strong cultural emphasis on social solidarity and harmony, rooted in collectivist values, which can act as a dominant meta-narrative that prioritizes group cohesion over individual expression.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "there still exists in South Korea a strong meta-narrative about social solidarity and harmony (cultural collectivism) that is further fuelled by anti-Japanese sentiments."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.lunduniversity.lu.se/lup/publication/9027911

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.feature: The collectivist culture in South Korea may limit individuals' freedom to opt out of societal movements or express personal perspectives, particularly during nationalistic events such as the No-Japan movement.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-co.original:
- Quoted text "this movement seems to be highly associated with South Korean’s strong collectivist culture, which might result in limiting individual’s liberty on participating in the movement and expressing its perspective."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.lunduniversity.lu.se/lup/publication/9027911

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-in.feature: The pursuit of personal freedom and self-expression among youth is often manifested through lifestyle choices, consumption patterns, and non-conformity to traditional norms.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-in.original:
- Quoted text "신세대는 “기성세대 혹은 구세대와 차별화되는 취향과 행동 양식 그리고 탈권위주의와 탈전통적인 자기주체성을 발현하는 집단”이다. 구체적으로는 개인주의를 추구하며, 소비와 취향을 중심으로 한 라이프 스타일을 추구한다. 소비적인 삶을 통해 욕망을 드러내고 충족하고자 한다. 자유분방함과 동시에 전통적인 규범에서 일탈한다."
  - Location paragraph 18

- Rule Description Personal autonomy has increasingly become evident in individual decisions regarding relationships, such as choosing partners and making marriage decisions independently from familial or societal structures.
- ===from https://unipress.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=8012

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-in.feature: Korean culture exhibits a collectivist orientation, where individuals are closely interconnected and group harmony is emphasized over individual achievement.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-in.original:
- Quoted text "Collectivism 중국, 한국"
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://adipo.tistory.com/entry/%ED%99%89%EC%8A%A4%ED%85%8C%EB%93%9CHofstede%EC%9D%98-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94%EC%B0%A8%EC%9B%90%EC%9D%B4%EB%A1%A0-%EA%B0%9C%EC%9D%B8%EC%A3%BC%EC%9D%98Indivisualism-VS-%EC%A7%91%EB%8B%A8%EC%A3%BC%EC%9D%98Collectivism-%EA%B6%8C%EB%A0%A5%EA%B0%84-%EA%B1%B0%EB%A6%ACPower-Distance-%EB%B6%88%ED%99%95%EC%8B%A4%EC%84%B1%EC%97%90-%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C-%ED%9A%8C%ED%94%BC-%EC%84%B1%ED%96%A5-%EB%82%A8%EC%84%B1%EC%A0%81-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-VS-%EC%97%AC%EC%84%B1%EC%A0%81-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%9C%A0%EA%B5%90%EC%A0%81-%EB%8F%99%EC%A0%81-%EC%B0%A8%EC%9B%90Confucian-dynamism

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: Achieving direct personal character and outstanding wisdom is considered a methodological principle in Korean traditional education, where filial piety serves as a foundation for人格 development and intellectual growth.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "효는 한국인들이 가장 소중하게 여기는 윤리적 덕목이요, 미풍양속이다. 교육학적 안목에서 보면 효는 직접적인 인격과 탁월한 지혜를 획득하는 방법적 원리이다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/138810

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: Establishing clear educational goals, such as立志 (setting one’s ambition), is a key component of the Confucian-inspired educational method emphasized in Korean tradition.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "율곡에게서 배울 수 있었던 경(敬) 이론을 통한 효 교육방법은 첫째, 교육의 목표로서 입지하는 것."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/138810

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: High levels of acculturative stress are associated with lower achievement motivation among multicultural students in South Korea.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "The findings show that high acculturative stress is linked to lower achievement motivation."
  - Location paragraph 1 (Introduction section)

---===from https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/psychology/articles/10.3389/fpsyg.2025.1652737/full

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: Higher perceived maternal Korean language proficiency is associated with higher achievement motivation when acculturative stress is low, but this advantage diminishes under high stress, where it instead intensifies the negative impact on achievement motivation.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "Students whose mothers have high Korean proficiency tend to exhibit higher achievement motivation when acculturative stress is low. However, as acculturative stress increases, their motivation declines more sharply compared to students whose mothers have low proficiency."
  - Location paragraph 2 (Discussion section)

---===from https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/psychology/articles/10.3389/fpsyg.2025.1652737/full

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: Rather than buffering against the negative effects of acculturative stress, high maternal Korean language proficiency acts as an exacerbating factor, leading to a steeper decline in achievement motivation when stress levels are high.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "the negative slope was steeper at high maternal proficiency, highlighting an exacerbation rather than a buffering effect."
  - Location paragraph 5 (Results section)===from https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/psychology/articles/10.3389/fpsyg.2025.1652737/full

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: Korean society places a high value on educational achievement, which serves as a key motivator for academic success and contributes to societal development, though it also creates significant pressure.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "Compared to other countries, Korean society places a high premium, pressure an investment on educational achievement. This has contributed to the rapid economic growth and development, but at the same time it has created numerous social problems."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://accesson.kr/kpacsi/v.14/%ED%8A%B9%EC%A7%91/2008

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: Parents' psychological motivations, such as their own past regrets or experiences related to education ("han" and regret), lead to controlling parenting styles and unrealistic expectations, which negatively affect children's academic motivation and success.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "On the contrary, parents' ‘han’ and regret indicated relationship with hostile and controlling parenting style and also with blind intention toward their children's educational career. The negative emotions also seemed to increase their children's academic stress, and lower academic self-efficacy."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://accesson.kr/kpacsi/v.14/%ED%8A%B9%EC%A7%91/2008

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: Parents who have experienced positive learning outcomes tend to adopt affectionate and autonomous parenting styles, promoting rational educational goals and supporting their children’s motivation toward achievement.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "The result revealed that parents' learning effect was related with more affective/autonomous parenting style and reasonable expectation for their children's educational career."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://accesson.kr/kpacsi/v.14/%ED%8A%B9%EC%A7%91/2008

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: As Korean students progress through school, especially from elementary to middle school, their intrinsic motivation and perceived competence decline, indicating reduced internal drive for achievement over time.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "Results of the literature analysis revealed that, in general, there was a decreasing tendency in perceived competence from elementary to middle school which followed by a slight increase after entering high school. Similar trend revealed in the development of autonomous motivation..."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://accesson.kr/kpacsi/v.14/%ED%8A%B9%EC%A7%91/2008

Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.feature: Competitive and controlled learning environments, along with frequent norm-referenced evaluations, reduce students’ sense of competence and diminish their interest in academic achievement.
Values_and_Beliefs-culture dimensions-mo.original:
- Quoted text "Three potentially contributing factors to the observed loss of academic interests are mainly discussed deprived autonomy, severe competition, and normative evaluation."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://accesson.kr/kpacsi/v.14/%ED%8A%B9%EC%A7%91/2008

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 한국 민간신앙은 자연현상, 동식물, 조상 등 다양한 존재를 신으로 섬기는 다신론적 특성을 가진다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "신앙의 대상이 되는 신이 매우 다양하다는 다신론적인 특징이 있다. 신앙의 대상으로는 천신 · 산신 등에서부터 사령(死靈) 등의 귀신까지를 포함하고 있다."
  - Location paragraph 18===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0020061

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 민간신앙은 개인보다는 가정이나 마을과 같은 생활공동체 전체를 위한 신앙이며, 개인의 문제도 공동체 차원에서 해결한다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "민간신앙은 개인신앙이라기보다는 생활공동체의 신앙이라는 점이다. 가정의 신앙이거나 마을 전체의 신앙이지 어느 개인을 위한 개인 단위의 신앙이 아니다."
  - Location paragraph 19===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0020061

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 민간신앙은 유교, 불교 등 외래종교와 상호보완적인 관계를 형성하며, 정상적이지 않은 문제나 원통한 영혼의 문제를 담당한다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "유교신앙이 정상적인 규칙적 문제를 취급하고 있음에 비하여, 무속신앙은 비정상적이고 비규칙적인 문제를 처리하는 메카니즘으로 기능하였던 것이다."
  - Location paragraph 20===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0020061

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 민간신앙은 장수, 병 낫기, 농사, 재물 등 구체적인 현세 이익을 추구하는 주술적 성격을 강하게 지닌다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "민간신앙은 구체적 생사화복(生死禍福)에 집착되어 있다는 사실이다... 특히, 재물을 얻기 위하여 기원하는 의례가 많다."
  - Location paragraph 21===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0020061

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Korea exhibits a unique model of multi-religious coexistence where major religions such as Protestantism, Buddhism, and Catholicism exist alongside a large non-religious population, and this diversity is also reflected within families.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "Korean society is a multi-religious coexistence society that is difficult to see in the world religious history. According to the 2021 Korea Research Survey, Protestants accounted for 20% of the total population, 17% Buddhists, and 11% Catholics, and 50% of the total population has no religion. This phenomenon is also common among Korean family members."  
  - Location p2===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/2092922

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: The coexistence of multiple religions in Korea is supported by the secularization of religion and the constitutional guarantee of religious freedom.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "The reason for this phenomenon can be explained as follows. First, the religious composition of Koreans, second, those religions are undergoing a process of secularization, and third, freedom of religion."  
  - Location p2===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/2092922

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Despite widespread religious coexistence, serious inter-religious conflicts and tensions exist in Korean society, including within family relationships.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "However, even in Korean society, there are serious conflicts and strife between religions. And this conflict also exists among family members."  
  - Location p2===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/2092922

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Sustaining religious coexistence requires ongoing dialogue between religions and the inclusion of religious education in public schooling to develop religious literacy in future generations.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "I believe that religions in our society should continue to have dialogue to understand each other. In addition, I believe that the order of religious coexistence can be solved by teaching religious education in public education. This is to enable the next generation to have the eyes of religious literacy."  
  - Location p3===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/2092922

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Shamanism and totemism are characteristics of Korea's indigenous religion (musok), which continues to influence Korean culture and religious views today.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "한국의 토착 종교인 무속신앙은 샤머니즘, 토테미즘 적 특징을 보이며 오늘날 한국인의 문화, 종교관에도 영향을 남기고 있다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://ko.wikipedia.org/wiki/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98_%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Buddhism was widely practiced in Korea from the Three Kingdoms period through the Goryeo dynasty, but its status declined during the Joseon dynasty due to the state’s promotion of Confucianism over Buddhism.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "불교는 삼국시대 신라에 의해 공인된 이후 고려시대까지 보편적인 종교로 믿어져 왔으나 조선시대에 들어 숭유억불로 불리는 유교 중심 체제로 지위에 흔들림을 겪기도 했다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://ko.wikipedia.org/wiki/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98_%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Christianity, introduced from the West, spread rapidly in modern times and now constitutes a significant portion of religious believers in South Korea.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "근현대에 들어서는 서양에서 유입된 기독교의 빠른 전파가 눈에 띄었다. 오늘날 대한민국에서는 인구의 절반이 종교가 없는 강한 세속주의 경향과 함께 기독교와 불교 신자가 상당수를 차지하고 있으며"
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://ko.wikipedia.org/wiki/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98_%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: In North Korea, religious activities are largely suppressed by the government, and individuals engaging in unauthorized religious practices face punishment.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "그러나 북한에서는 관제(官制) 종교활동을 제외하면 종교활동이 전혀 이루어질 수 없으며 종교활동 시 반드시 처벌받고 있다는 것이 탈북자들의 일치된 증언이다"
  - Location paragraph 2 (under "조선민주주의인민공화국")===from https://ko.wikipedia.org/wiki/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98_%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: During the Three Kingdoms period, foreign religions such as Buddhism were introduced and coexisted with native beliefs under state sponsorship.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "삼국이 제각기 외래종교를 채용하였다. 이리하여 재래신앙과 외래종교가 공존하였다."
  - Location paragraph 2 (under "삼국시대")===from https://ko.wikipedia.org/wiki/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98_%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Koreans generally view religious truth as relative and inclusive rather than absolute, and believe that all religions hold equal value.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "한국인들은 종교의 진리를 절대적이기보다는 상대적이고 포용적으로 인식하며, 대부분의 사람들이 모든 종교가 동등한 가치를 지닌다고 생각한다."
  - Location p6===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/series/religion-annual

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Unlike followers of other religions, Protestant Christians in Korea tend to view religious truth as absolute and exhibit exclusivist tendencies.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "다만 개신교 신자들은 다른 종교 신자들과 달리 종교의 진리를 절대적으로 보고 배타적인 특성을 보인다."
  - Location p6===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/series/religion-annual

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Younger generations in Korea are less likely to participate in religious activities or consider religion important, contributing to a trend of religious decline among the youth.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "40대 이하는 50대 이상과 비교할 때 종교인구 비율도 적을 뿐만 아니라 종교활동 참여 빈도도 적고, 종교활동을 중요하게 생각하는 비율도 낮다."
  - Location p8===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/series/religion-annual

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Over half of South Korean adults identify as having no religion, indicating a majority non-religious population.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "우리나라 성인의 절반 이상이 종교가 없으며, 종교인 중에서는 개신교, 불교, 천주교 순으로 많다."
  - Location p7===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/series/religion-annual

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Nearly half of religious believers in Korea are aged 60 or older, revealing a severely aging religious population with few young adherents.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "신자의 절반 가까이가 60세 이상이고 젊은층은 다수가 무종교인 극심한 고령화 구조가 확인된다."
  - Location p1===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/series/religion-annual

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 고려 시대에는 불교가 대중적으로 퍼져 있었으나, 조선 시대에 들어 유교를 숭상하고 불교를 억압하는 정책(숭유억불)으로 인해 불교는 쇠퇴하였다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "고려 시대까지는 불교가 대중화되었으나 조선 시대에 들어서는 숭유억불에 따라 쇠퇴하기도 했다."
  - Location paragraph 16===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 근대화 이후 평안도에서 전라도에 이르는 서부 지역을 중심으로 기독교가 전파되었으며, 특히 남한의 서해안 지역(서해5도, 강화도부터 호남까지)에서 개신교의 영향력이 강하다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "근대화 이후 평안도에서 전라도까지 서부 지역을 중심으로 기독교가 전파되었다. 남한에서도 역시 서해5도와 강화도부터 호남까지 서해안을 중심으로 개신교의 위세가 특히 높고"
  - Location paragraph 16===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 경기와 충청 동부 지역에서는 여러 종교의 세력이 비슷하게 존재하며, 강원도, 충북 동부, 영남 지역은 불교의 영향력이 특히 강하다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "경기, 충청 동부는 여러 종교가 비등비등하며 강원도, 충북 동부, 영남 지방은 불교의 위세가 특히 강하다."
  - Location paragraph 16===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 한국은 사찰, 교회, 성당 등 다양한 종교 시설이 각지에 분포되어 있는 다종교 사회이다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "사찰과 교회, 성당 등이 각지에 퍼져서 분포하는 다종교 사회를 이룬다."
  - Location paragraph 16===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 한국 국민의 과반수는 무종교이며, 무종교인들은 종교인에 대해 다소 부정적인 인식을 가지고 있다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "국민의 과반수는 무종교이며, 무종교인들은 종교인에 대한 부정적인 인식이 다소 강하다."
  - Location paragraph 16===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Korean religious culture has preserved the ancient Chinese anthropomorphic concept of “Sangje” (Supreme God), which disappeared in later Chinese traditions, integrating it into Confucianism and linking it to indigenous beliefs in a personal heavenly deity ("Hananim").
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "한국유교문화는 이 두 가지 범주의 신개념을 모두 수용했다. 그러나 중국에서는 상고대 이후 사라져 버린 인격신 ‘상제’의 원형을 그대로 보존해 온 것이 특징이라고 본다. 이는 한국고대 종교문화가 가지는 ‘하느님’ 신앙과 연결되는 특징으로서, 한국유교문화의 고유한 일면을 보여준다."
  - Location p3

---

- Rule Description Korean Confucian thought incorporates both transcendent cosmic order (e.g., “Li” as emphasized by Toegye) and dynamic spiritual presence (e.g., through “Ki” as explored by Yulgok), reflecting a dual understanding of the divine that approaches modern theological ideas of both Creator and creativity.
- ===from https://www.krm.or.kr/krmts/search/detailview/research.html?dbGubun=SD&m201_id=10014989

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: The introduction of Western religions, particularly Christianity, caused a significant cultural shock in Korea, leading to intense conflict with traditional religious beliefs and practices, especially regarding Confucian ancestral rites.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "한국 그리스도교의 선발 세력이었던 천주교(Catholic)는 전통적인 종교문화 및 세계관과 심각한 양상의 대립과 갈등을 빚어내었다. 천주교는 ‘교회’ 혹은 ‘집회’를 의미하는 강력한 신앙공동체인 ‘에클레시아’를 형성하는 과정에서 유교식 제사 문제 등을 중심으로 전통적 믿음 및 세계관과 충돌을 빚게 되었다."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://contents.history.go.kr/front/km/view.do?levelId=km_031_0060_0010

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Early Catholics in Korea faced severe persecution, resulting in the deaths of thousands who were killed due to differences in religious worldview.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "그리하여 ‘일만 여명에 달하는’ 천주교 신자들이 종교적 세계관의 차이 때문에 죽임을 당하는 극심한 박해사(迫害史)가 펼쳐졌던 것이다."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://contents.history.go.kr/front/km/view.do?levelId=km_031_0060_0010

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Due to restrictions on missionary activities, Christian missionaries disguised themselves in mourning clothes to travel and conduct pastoral work secretly.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "천주교의 포교 활동금지는 선교사들의 공개적인 활동을 저해하게 되었고, 그러한 장벽을 귁복하기 위해 선교사들이 상복(喪服)으로 위장하여 사목지(司牧地)를 오가기도 하였다."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://contents.history.go.kr/front/km/view.do?levelId=km_031_0060_0010

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Protestant missionaries, arriving later than Catholics, adopted a policy of avoiding direct confrontation and persecution by learning from the earlier Catholic experience, though they still encountered various conflicts with existing belief systems.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "한국 그리스도교 선교의 후발 세력인 개신교(Protestant)는 선교 초기부터 선발 그리스도교 세력인 천주교의 역사적인 경험을 교과서 삼아 직접적인 충돌과 박해를 피하려는 선교 정책을 구사하였다. 하지만 전통문화와 크고 작은 갈등을 빚어 왔음을 부인하기는 어렵다."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://contents.history.go.kr/front/km/view.do?levelId=km_031_0060_0010

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Korea is characterized by the coexistence of diverse religions and belief systems, which significantly influence its society and culture.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "한국은 다양한 종교와 신념 체계가 공존하는 문화적 배경을 갖고 있습니다. 이러한 다양성은 한국 사회와 역사에 큰 영향을 미치고 있으며, 종교가 한국 사회 전반에 미치는 영향력은 무시할 수 없습니다."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://imsensist.tistory.com/entry/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90%EC%99%80-%EC%8B%A0%EB%85%90-%EC%B2%B4%EA%B3%84%EC%97%90-%EB%8C%80%ED%95%B4%EC%84%9C

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Traditional belief systems play a central role in shaping Korean societal structure, individual lives, and cultural identity.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "전통적인 신앙 체계는 한국 사회 구조와 개인의 삶에 큰 영향을 미치며, 종교 행사와 의식은 사회적 연대와 정체성 형성에 중요한 역할을 한다."  
  - Location paragraph 20===from https://imsensist.tistory.com/entry/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90%EC%99%80-%EC%8B%A0%EB%85%90-%EC%B2%B4%EA%B3%84%EC%97%90-%EB%8C%80%ED%95%B4%EC%84%9C

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Religion in Korea contributes to fostering community consciousness, moral values, and ethical behavior within society.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "종교는 한국 사회에서 공동체 의식을 형성하고, 도덕적 가치 및 희생을 증진시키는 역할을 한다."
