  - Location paragraph 20===from https://imsensist.tistory.com/entry/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90%EC%99%80-%EC%8B%A0%EB%85%90-%EC%B2%B4%EA%B3%84%EC%97%90-%EB%8C%80%ED%95%B4%EC%84%9C

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Religious ceremonies and rituals are highly valued in Korea, serving as key means for expressing identity, maintaining cultural heritage, and strengthening emotional stability and social bonds.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "종교 행사와 의식은 한국 사회에 깊은 영향력을 행사하고 있습니다. 이를 통해 한국인들은 공동체 의식을 고취시키고 문화 유산을 보존하며, 삶의 방향과 의미를 찾아가고 있습니다."  
  - Location paragraph 19===from https://imsensist.tistory.com/entry/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90%EC%99%80-%EC%8B%A0%EB%85%90-%EC%B2%B4%EA%B3%84%EC%97%90-%EB%8C%80%ED%95%B4%EC%84%9C

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: Over half of South Korea's population identifies with a religion, indicating that religious thought and values remain socially significant and provide emotional stability and social cohesion.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "최근 조사에 따르면, 한국의 종교인구 비율은 약 56%로, 국민의 절반 이상이 종교를 가지고 있다고 합니다. 이는 한국 사회가 여전히 종교적인 사고와 가치관을 중요시하는 것을 보여줍니다."  
  - Location paragraph 15===from https://imsensist.tistory.com/entry/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%98-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%EC%A2%85%EA%B5%90%EC%99%80-%EC%8B%A0%EB%85%90-%EC%B2%B4%EA%B3%84%EC%97%90-%EB%8C%80%ED%95%B4%EC%84%9C

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 많은 한국인은 과거와 비교했을 때 현재 사회에서 종교의 영향력이 크게 변하지 않았다고 인식하고 있다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "과거와 비슷하다"
  - Location p1 (q48 survey result 54.1% selected "과거와 비슷하다")===from https://kossda.snu.ac.kr/handle/20.500.12236/25960

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 다수의 한국인은 종교가 우리 사회에 별로 도움을 주지 않거나 전혀 도움을 주지 않는다고 생각한다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "별로 도움을 주지 않는다", "전혀 도움을 주지 않는다"
  - Location p1 (q49 survey result 49.9% chose "별로 도움을 주지 않는다", 13.2% chose "전혀 도움을 주지 않는다")===from https://kossda.snu.ac.kr/handle/20.500.12236/25960

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 대부분의 한국인에게 종교는 개인 생활에서 중요하지 않거나 별로 중요하지 않은 것으로 인식되고 있다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "별로 중요하지 않다", "전혀 중요하지 않다"
  - Location p1 (q50 survey result 47% selected "별로 중요하지 않다", 16.1% selected "전히 중요하지 않다")===from https://kossda.snu.ac.kr/handle/20.500.12236/25960

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 한국 성인 대다수는 현재 믿는 종교가 없으며, 종교를 믿는 사람은 소수이다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "현재 믿는 종교 없음"
  - Location p1 (q51 survey result 61.7% selected "현재 믿는 종교 없음")===from https://kossda.snu.ac.kr/handle/20.500.12236/25960

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 상대적으로 많은 한국인이 기적이 존재한다고 믿고 있다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "존재한다"
  - Location p1 (q58_4 survey result 56% selected "존재한다" for "기적")===from https://kossda.snu.ac.kr/handle/20.500.12236/25960

Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.feature: 한국 가정 중 다수는 설이나 추석에 유교식으로 차례를 지내며, 일부는 차례를 지내지 않는다.
Values_and_Beliefs-religion-religion.original:
- Quoted text "유교식으로 절을 하십니까, 아니면 기독교식으로 기도나 묵상을 하십니까?", "유교식", "차례를 지내지 않는다"
  - Location p1 (q59 survey result 57.6% chose "유교식", 32.5% chose "차례를 지내지 않는다")===from https://kossda.snu.ac.kr/handle/20.500.12236/25960

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.feature: Koreans often respond to compliments with modest denials or downplay the praise to avoid appearing arrogant, as humility is a valued social norm.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.original:
- Quoted text "Accepting a compliment too readily might be seen as arrogant or self-centered. That’s why Koreans often respond to praise with phrases like '아니에요.' – 'No, not really.' '별거 아니에요.' – 'It’s nothing.'"  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.koreanhabits.com/2025/07/how-koreans-react-to-compliments.html

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.feature: Compliments about physical appearance, especially from strangers or people who are not close, can be uncomfortable or considered inappropriate in Korean culture.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.original:
- Quoted text "In Korea, compliments about appearance, especially from strangers or new acquaintances, can feel uncomfortable. While well-meant, they may be seen as overly personal or even inappropriate in certain contexts."  
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://www.koreanhabits.com/2025/07/how-koreans-react-to-compliments.html

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.feature: Compliments focusing on effort, achievement, or personal qualities are more culturally appropriate and better received than those about physical appearance.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.original:
- Quoted text "Instead, focus on complimenting effort or achievement. Saying 'You worked really hard on this' or 'You’re very thoughtful' is more culturally appropriate than 'You’re so pretty.' Compliments carry more weight when they focus on character, not just looks."  
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://www.koreanhabits.com/2025/07/how-koreans-react-to-compliments.html

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.feature: To be effective, compliments in Korea should be sincere, situation-specific, and focused on observable efforts such as cooking or language skills.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.original:
- Quoted text "If you want to compliment someone in Korea and make it land well, keep it sincere and situational. Praise specific efforts, such as their cooking, fashion sense, or language skills."  
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://www.koreanhabits.com/2025/07/how-koreans-react-to-compliments.html

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.feature: Responding to compliments with humility and reciprocating with modest gestures like a smile, bow, or mutual compliment helps preserve social harmony.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-compl.original:
- Quoted text "Koreans may downplay the praise, but rest assured—they still appreciate it. A simple smile, bow, or reciprocal compliment like 'You too!' helps maintain harmony in the exchange."  
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://www.koreanhabits.com/2025/07/how-koreans-react-to-compliments.html

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.feature: In traditional Korean education, scholarly achievement was closely linked to public service, and educated individuals often held government positions as part of their role in society.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.original:
- Quoted text "김안국 조선전기 수교리, 예조판서, 판중추부사 등을 역임한 문신. 학자."
  - Location p1===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.feature: During the Japanese colonial period, education was used as a tool to promote rural enlightenment and strengthen national consciousness among Koreans.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.original:
- Quoted text "최용신 일제강점기 안산 지역에서 농촌계몽과 민족의식을 고취시킨 사회운동가. 농촌운동가, 교육자."
  - Location p2===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.feature: School education in Korea has been led by individuals who served in key institutional roles such as school principals, university professors, and educational administrators.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.original:
- Quoted text "구용현 문교부 장학실장, 부산직할시교육위원회 교육감, 국회의원 등을 역임한 교육자."
  - Location p3
- ===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.feature: Some educators during the Japanese colonial period promoted the non-church movement as part of their educational philosophy.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.original:
- Quoted text "김교신 일제강점기 무교회주의를 제창한 교육자. 종교인."
  - Location p6===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.feature: 한국 사회는 높은 교육열을 가지고 있으며, 교육이 입시 중심으로 운영되고 있다.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-educa.original:
- Quoted text "교육열 · 입시 위주 교육 · 문제점"
  - Location paragraph 19===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.feature: Public criticism of political leadership, especially through cultural expression, can trigger state retaliation in the form of blacklisting artists and restricting their access to public funding.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.original:
- Quoted text "One of the major reasons for her impeachment was the infringment of constitutional rights, notably the curtailing of freedom of expression through the drafting of a cultural blacklist with regard to public funding of the arts."
  - Location p1===from https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10286632.2018.1557652

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.feature: Citizens engage in large-scale, peaceful political protests using culturally symbolic actions (such as candlelight rallies) to demand accountability from political leaders.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.original:
- Quoted text "The unprecedented impeachment of a president (President Park Geun-Hye), following popular grass-roots candlelight rallies, was closely associated with issues of cultural policy."
  - Location p1===from https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10286632.2018.1557652

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.feature: The government has engaged in systematic abuse of power by blacklisting artists perceived as critical of the administration, thereby coercing compliance and suppressing dissent.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.original:
- Quoted text "Among the eighteen charges, those relating to the cultural field included abuse of power and coercion in planning, together with the blacklisting of around 9,000 artists."
  - Location p1 (Footnote 1)===from https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10286632.2018.1557652

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.feature: State bureaucrats hold significant power in defining and regulating culture, which enables them to suppress political criticism by controlling funding and implementation of cultural programs.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.original:
- Quoted text "Bureaucrats were able to dominate the cultural policy field since they were entrusted with the role of not only defining and interpreting culture but also of applying and implementing cultural programs at the administrative level."
  - Location p3===from https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10286632.2018.1557652

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.feature: Criticizing or expressing views about political parties in South Korea is associated with extremely high levels of societal conflict, indicating that political criticism is a deeply divisive and sensitive topic.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.original:
- Quoted text "가장 먼저 정치적 정당 간의 갈등의 심각성은 한국이 무려 91%를 기록하면서 전 세계 1위를 차지했습니다."
  - Location paragraph 23===from https://www.ipsos.com/ko-kr/culture-wars-in-south-korea

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.feature: Expressing political opinions related to ideological positions, such as progressive or conservative views, contributes to significant societal tension, making such criticism highly contentious in Korean society.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-polit.original:
- Quoted text "진보와 보수 간의 이념적 갈등의 심각성에 대한 항목에서는 한국이 87%로 전 세계에서 1위를 차지했습니다."
  - Location paragraph 26===from https://www.ipsos.com/ko-kr/culture-wars-in-south-korea

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-ethni.feature: The concept of being ethnically Korean ("한민족") or a "Korean" is not seen as a fixed or universally accepted identity, but rather as a changing and internally diverse construct that varies across generations, social classes, and value systems.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-ethni.original:
- Quoted text "본 조사는 ‘한민족’ 또는 ‘한국인’으로서의 정체성이 더 이상 누구나 당연시하는 고정된 태도가 아니며, 한국인 내부에서도 세대, 계층, 가치관 등에 따라 복합적으로 분화되는 새로운 양상을 역동적으로 분석하는데 적절한 자료이다."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from http://asiaticresearch.org/sub04/sub04_3_3.html

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-ethni.feature: Attitudes toward multicultural policies and the integration of immigrants and foreigners are considered relevant aspects of Korean ethnic and national identity, indicating an evolving perspective on who is included within the national community.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-ethni.original:
- Quoted text "이주민과 외국인의 사회통합, 다문화 정책의 도입, 동아시아 공동체에 대한 인식 등 새롭게 부상하는 현안과 미래지향적 가치에 대한 태도들을 폭넓게 조사하고 있다."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from http://asiaticresearch.org/sub04/sub04_3_3.html

Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-stere.feature: Cultural stereotyping is recognized as a key issue in Korean culture education that needs to be actively managed, and educational interventions can improve cultural intelligence (CQ) related to handling stereotypes.
Values_and_Beliefs-Do's and Don'ts-stere.original:
- Quoted text "How to manage our cultural stereotyping was the topic of the class, as stereotyping is one of the main issues to be handled in culture education."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/549738

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Natura.feature: Korean cultural understanding of the world begins with the human body, and bodily awareness is foundational to linguistic and cognitive development in Korean language.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Natura.original:
- Quoted text "한국인들이 세계에 대한 인식은 자기 몸에 대한 인식부터 시작한데 언어 면에서는 신체언어의 발달이 필연적으로 나타나는 법이다. 즉 신체언어에 관한 어휘들을 통하여 세계에 대한 인식을 더 발전시킨 것이다. 다시 말하면 신체언어는 한국인과 세계를 연결시키는 셈이다."
  - Location paragraph 5===from http://www.youkrackbooks.com/?books=%E9%9F%A9%E5%9B%BD%E8%87%AA%E7%84%B6%E6%96%87%E5%8C%96%E8%AF%AD%E8%A8%80%E5%AD%A6%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9E%90%EC%97%B0%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94%EC%96%B8%EC%96%B4%ED%95%99

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Natura.feature: Natural environment and flora/fauna are deeply embedded in Korean cultural cognition, and their perception has led to the creation of culturally meaningful linguistic expressions such as idioms, proverbs, and culture-specific vocabulary.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Natura.original:
- Quoted text "세계에 대한 인류의 인식에는 자연환경과 동식물에 관한 인식도 포함되어 있다. 특히 원시인들이 세계에 대한 인식은 자연세계와 상상에서 시작한 것이다. 그리고 생존을 위하여 그들이 부득이하게 주변 세계를 탐구, 이용 심지어 개조시켜야 했다. 인류의 상상과 관심으로 인하여 자연세계는 인류의 의식 속에 들어가고 부호화되고 의미를 부여하게 되고 이렇게 생긴 문화의미의 일부는 최종적으로 언어로 표현되고 문화 어휘와 관용어 그리고 속담 등은 생긴 것이다."
  - Location paragraph 6===from http://www.youkrackbooks.com/?books=%E9%9F%A9%E5%9B%BD%E8%87%AA%E7%84%B6%E6%96%87%E5%8C%96%E8%AF%AD%E8%A8%80%E5%AD%A6%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9E%90%EC%97%B0%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94%EC%96%B8%EC%96%B4%ED%95%99

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Natura.feature: Natural culture, including the human body, environment, animals, and plants, forms the material basis necessary for the existence of abstract spiritual culture in Korea; without these concrete elements, spiritual culture would lack a foundation.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Natura.original:
- Quoted text "자연문화는 자연세계의 세부사항과 관련되어 있고 이 세부사항들이야말로 문화를 이루게 하고 관련 인체. 환경, 동식물 등은 물질적인 성질이 강하지만 추상적인 정신문화와 뗄 수 없는 관계를 갖고 있어 이 구체적인 물질들이 존재하지 않으면 추상적인 정신은 안신할 데가 없어지게 될 것이다."
  - Location paragraph 7===from http://www.youkrackbooks.com/?books=%E9%9F%A9%E5%9B%BD%E8%87%AA%E7%84%B6%E6%96%87%E5%8C%96%E8%AF%AD%E8%A8%80%E5%AD%A6%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9E%90%EC%97%B0%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94%EC%96%B8%EC%96%B4%ED%95%99

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Korean festivals are community events that combine celebratory feasts with ceremonial functions, reflecting both cultural and ritual significance.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "The festival is a local event that has the function of a celebration as a feast and for certain ceremonies."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/1988878

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Approximately 900 festivals are held annually in Korea, indicating a widespread cultural practice of organizing and participating in festivals.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "About 900 festivals are held in Korea every year."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://dspace.kci.go.kr/handle/kci/1988878

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 한국의 주요 명절들은 농경 사회의 자연 주기와 밀접하게 연결된 전통을 기반으로 하며, 이는 24절기와 같은 농업 중심의 시간 개념에서 비롯된다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "명절 (주요 명절 · 설날 · 추석 · 한식 · 단오 · 정월대보름 · 24절기 · 민족 최대의 명절 논쟁)"
  - Location p1===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 한국의 명절은 조상 숭배 및 가족 간 유대 강화를 위한 의식의 일환으로, 성묘와 같은 활동이 포함된다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "명절에 가족 차를 얻어타고 성묘하러 가면, 마을마다 꼭 하나씩은 자그마한 교회가 들어서 있는 모습을 볼 수 있다."
  - Location p3===from https://namu.wiki/w/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD/%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Seollal, the Lunar New Year, is a major Korean festival emphasizing family unity and honoring ancestors through rituals like "charye," where food offerings are made to deceased family members.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "Celebrated on the first day of the lunar calendar, this festival represents family unity and respect for ancestors."
  - Location paragraph 4

- Rule Description The charye ritual during Seollal involves preparing a carefully arranged table of food offerings for ancestors, reflecting Confucian values deeply embedded in Korean culture.
- ===from https://everythingkorea.blog/2025/03/20/korean-traditional-festivals-celebrations-throughout-the-year/

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Chuseok, also known as the Korean Harvest Moon Festival or Korean Thanksgiving, is a time of communal joy and ancestral veneration, centered around gratitude for bountiful harvests.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "“Chuseok,” often referred to as the Korean Harvest Moon Festival or Korean Thanksgiving, is another monumental celebration that underscores profound gratitude for bountiful harvests. Falling on the 15th day of the 8th lunar month, Chuseok embodies communal joy and ancestral veneration."
  - Location paragraph 5

- Rule Description During Chuseok, families honor ancestors through the charye ritual, which includes preparing symbolic dishes such as songpyeon and jeon to express respect and gratitude.
- ===from https://everythingkorea.blog/2025/03/20/korean-traditional-festivals-celebrations-throughout-the-year/

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Dano is an ancient festival celebrated on the fifth day of the fifth lunar month, dedicated to cleansing, renewal, and traditional shamanistic rituals.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "Moreover, “Dano,” an ancient festival dating back to the Goryeo Dynasty, is celebrated on the fifth day of the fifth month in the lunar calendar. It is a time for cleansing and renewal, and is also known for traditional rites and shamanistic rituals."
  - Location paragraph 6

- Rule Description Women participate in the custom of washing their hair in sweet flag (changpo) water during Dano for protection and health, based on traditional beliefs.
- ===from https://everythingkorea.blog/2025/03/20/korean-traditional-festivals-celebrations-throughout-the-year/

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Dongji, the Korean Winter Solstice Festival, involves preparing patjuk (red bean porridge) with rice cake balls to ward off evil spirits and bring health and protection to families.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "One cannot overlook the significance of Dongji, the Korean Winter Solstice Festival, where Patjuk, a red bean porridge dotted with chewy rice cake balls called Saealsim, is prepared. This dish is traditionally believed to ward off evil spirits and bring health and protection to families."
  - Location paragraph 11

- Rule Description The red color of patjuk consumed during Dongji is culturally associated with driving away malevolent forces, reinforcing its role as a protective symbol in Korean tradition.
- ===from https://everythingkorea.blog/2025/03/20/korean-traditional-festivals-celebrations-throughout-the-year/

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Families gather during Seollal to share traditional foods like tteokguk and perform ancestral rites called charye; children wear new clothes and perform deep bows (sebae) to elders, who in turn give money gifts (sebaetdon).
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "On the Lunar New Year’s Day, families gather to share special foods such as tteokguk and hold rituals called charye (a simplified form of an ancestral rite). Children and sometimes youths wear new clothes (called seolbim) to bow before their elders (called sebae), wishing them a long life. After the bow, the elders are customarily expected to give money gifts (called sebaetdon) to those who bowed."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.korea.net/AboutKorea/Society/Festivals-Celebrations-and-Holidays

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Celebrated on the 15th day of lunar January, this festival involves eating ogokbap (a dish made of five grains) with cooked vegetables, playing games, and performing rituals for community unity and a good harvest.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "Another important seasonal festival is Jeongwol Daeboreum (Greater Full Moon), celebrated on the 15th day of the lunar January. It is celebrated by eating ogokbap, a special dish made by steaming a mix of five different grains, served with an assortment of cooked vegetables. People also play various games and rituals for the unity of the local community and a good harvest."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.korea.net/AboutKorea/Society/Festivals-Celebrations-and-Holidays

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: Chuseok, held on the 15th day of lunar August, is one of Korea’s most important holidays, during which family members gather to honor ancestors using newly harvested crops and fruits, and eat songpyeon (special rice cakes).
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "Along with the Lunar New Year’s Day, Chuseok, or hangawi, is one of the biggest and most important holidays in Korea, which is held on the 15th day of lunar August. On Chuseok, all family members gather around to pay respect to ancestors with newly harvested crops and fruits, and eat special rice cakes called songpyeon."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.korea.net/AboutKorea/Society/Festivals-Celebrations-and-Holidays

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 한국의 명절에서는 조상에게 감사의 마음을 전하는 전통이 있다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "설날과 추석은 대표적인 명절로, 조상에게 감사의 마음을 전하고 가족과 함께 음식을 나누는 전통이 있습니다."  
  - Location p5===from https://wonderang.tistory.com/entry/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD-%EB%8C%80%ED%91%9C-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94%EC%9E%AC-%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD-%ED%8A%B9%EC%A7%95-%EC%A0%95%EB%A6%AC

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 한국의 명절 문화에서는 가족과 함께하며 음식을 나누는 것이 중요한 전통으로 여겨진다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "설날과 추석은 대표적인 명절로, 조상에게 감사의 마음을 전하고 가족과 함께 음식을 나누는 전통이 있습니다."  
  - Location p5===from https://wonderang.tistory.com/entry/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD-%EB%8C%80%ED%91%9C-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94%EC%9E%AC-%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD-%ED%8A%B9%EC%A7%95-%EC%A0%95%EB%A6%AC

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 한국의 명절 문화는 세대를 이어주는 중요한 연결고리로 기능한다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "이러한 명절 문화는 세대를 이어가는 중요한 연결고리가 됩니다."  
  - Location p5===from https://wonderang.tistory.com/entry/%EB%8C%80%ED%95%9C%EB%AF%BC%EA%B5%AD-%EB%8C%80%ED%91%9C-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94-%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD-%EB%AC%B8%ED%99%94%EC%9E%AC-%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD-%ED%8A%B9%EC%A7%95-%EC%A0%95%EB%A6%AC

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 강릉단오제는 단옷날을 전후하여 서낭신에게 지내는 마을 공동축제로, 제사는 여러 서낭당에서 차례로 진행된다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "강원특별자치도 강릉시에서 단옷날을 전후하여 서낭신에게 지내는 마을 공동축제."
  - Location p7===from https://www.doopedia.co.kr/doopedia/theme/theme.do?_method=list&MTH_IDX_CD=14

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 강릉단오제는 국가무형유산으로 지정되었으며, 유네스코 인류무형문화유산 대표목록에 등재되었다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "1967년 1월 16일 국가무형유산으로 지정되었으며, 2005년 유네스코 인류무형문화유산 대표목록으로 지정되었다."
  - Location p7===from https://www.doopedia.co.kr/doopedia/theme/theme.do?_method=list&MTH_IDX_CD=14

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 강릉 망월제는 음력 정월 대보름에 달을 보며 소망을 기원하는 축제로, 전통적인 달맞이 행사에서 유래하였다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "강원특별자치도 강릉시에서 매년 음력 정월 대보름에 달을 보면서 소망을 기원하는 축제."
  - Location p6===from https://www.doopedia.co.kr/doopedia/theme/theme.do?_method=list&MTH_IDX_CD=14

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 강릉 경포대 벚꽃축제는 매년 4월 초순에 벚꽃 개화기를 중심으로 열리는 계절 문화축제이다.
Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "강원특별자치도 강릉시 경포대에서 해마다 4월에 벚꽃을 주제로 열리는 문화축제."
  - Location p5===from https://www.doopedia.co.kr/doopedia/theme/theme.do?_method=list&MTH_IDX_CD=14

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 설날은 한국에서 가장 중요한 명절 중 하나로, 가족들이 함께 모여 조상에게 제사를 지내고 전통 음식을 먹으며 세배를 나누는 등 민족 최대의 명절로 여겨진다.

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.feature: 추석은 한국의 주요 명절 중 하나로, 가족이 모여 수확을 기리는 성격의 축제로서 조상 숭배와 함께 민족 최대의 명절로 간주된다.

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:

Geography_and_Customs-Dates of Significa.original:
- Quoted text "명절 (주요 명절 · 설날 · 추석 · 한식 · 단오 · 정월대보름 · 24절기 · 민족 최대의 명절 논쟁)"

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: In group settings such as meals or drinking sessions, the payment is typically made entirely by one person rather than being split among participants, a practice referred to as "Korean Pay."
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "‘한 사람이 무리 전체의 몫을 다 지불하는 문화’를 가급적 줄이고 각자가 자신의 몫을 계산하는 더치페이 문화가 광범위하게 일상화되면 얻는 장점이 매우 많다."
  - Location p1===from https://www.mediawatch.kr/mobile/article.html?no=239105

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: The person expected to pay in a group setting is determined by an unspoken hierarchy based on age, seniority in school, workplace position, gender, and nationality, with older individuals, seniors, superiors, men, and Koreans (when foreigners are present) being expected to pay.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "실상을 살펴 보면 코리안 페이는 여럿이 한 자리에서 식사나 음주 등을 하고 나서면서 경제적으로 부유한 사람보다는 경제력과 무관하게 1. 연장자가 2. 학교 선배가 3. 직장 상사가 4. 남자가 5. (외국인과 함께 있을 때) 한국인이 주로 내게 되는 식으로 암묵적인 강제로도 은연중 작용하고 있다."
  - Location p2===from https://www.mediawatch.kr/mobile/article.html?no=239105

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Individuals who do not pay when expected under the Korean Pay norm may be negatively judged as disrespectful, incompetent, or stingy, leading to social stress and avoidance of social gatherings.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "그래서 코리안 페이 방식이 이루어지지 않을 때는 1. 나이를 헛 먹은 사람 2. 칠칠맞고 볼 일 없는 선배 3. 무능한 상사 4. 째째한 남자 5. 외국인에게 불친절하고 한국 망신 다 시키는 사람 등으로 비춰질까 각종 인간관계에서 스트레스를 양산하고 있음도 사실이다."
  - Location p2===from https://www.mediawatch.kr/mobile/article.html?no=239105

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Older or financially constrained individuals may avoid attending social events due to the implicit expectation of paying for the entire group, which undermines the purpose of social bonding.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "그래서 연세가 좀 지긋한 사람들은 지갑이 얇으면 각종 모임에 초대 받아도 심적 부담을 느껴서 아예 참석을 기피하게 된다고 한다."
  - Location p3===from https://www.mediawatch.kr/mobile/article.html?no=239105

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Unlike in some foreign cultures where someone explicitly announces they will treat others, Koreans often do not make prior agreements about payment, leading to awkward situations where people avoid the bill through indirect behaviors like going to the restroom.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "하지만 한국인들은 사전 약속 없이 식사나 음주 후 계산대 앞에서 서로 눈치보는 진풍경까지 벌어진다. 이때 화장실에 간다는지 구두끈을 묶는다든지 하는 재미있는 백태가 벌어진다."
  - Location p4===from https://www.mediawatch.kr/mobile/article.html?no=239105

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: In dating situations, there is a prevailing cultural expectation that men bear the full cost of the date, which causes stress for both genders and differs from practices in other countries like Japan.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "그리하여 유독 한국만은 데이트 비용을 일방적으로 남자가 부담해야 한다는 문화가 아직도 상존하고 있다."
  - Location p4===from https://www.mediawatch.kr/mobile/article.html?no=239105

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: When dining with foreigners, Koreans often end up paying the full amount due to Korean Pay customs, but this can lead to foreigners taking advantage or even looking down on Koreans, perceiving them as lacking self-respect.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "또 코리안 페이 문화를 이해할 수 없는 외국인과의 만남에서 한국인이 이 방식으로 전부를 부담하게 되는 경우, 그 접대를 받는 외국인들은 처음에는 땡큐(Thank you!)를 연발하지만 점차 이에 익숙해지면 오히려 한국인을 업신여기고 심지어 한국인들은 자존심이 없다고 경멸하기까지 하는 경우도 다반사다."
  - Location p6===from https://www.mediawatch.kr/mobile/article.html?no=239105

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Since only one person pays for the group, others feel no financial responsibility, which encourages excessive drinking and makes it difficult for the payer to refuse further rounds due to social expectations of generosity and status display.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "그 한 사람을 제외한 나머지는 부담을 느끼지 않으므로 자연스럽게 '부으라 마셔라!' 하는 폭음을 부추기게 된다."
  - Location p7===from https://www.mediawatch.kr/mobile/article.html?no=239105

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Foreigners are surprised by the cleanliness, systematic operation, and convenience of South Korea’s public transportation, which includes punctual subway and bus services, free Wi-Fi, charging stations, clean restrooms, detailed signage, and the use of a single transit card across different modes of transport.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "한국의 대중교통은 외국인들에게 깔끔하고, 체계적이라는 평가를 받는다. 서울과 같은 대도시에서는 지하철과 버스가 정시 운행되고, 무료 왴파이와 충전 시설까지 갖춰져 있다. 또한 하나의 교통카드로 버스와 지하철을 동시에 이용할 수 있어 이동이 편리하다. 특히 지하철역에 있는 청결한 화장실과 상세한 안내 표지는 한국의 세심함을 엿볼 수 있는 부분이다."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.wikitree.co.kr/articles/1001882

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Koreans tend to plan domestic vacations during the summer months, particularly July and August.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "The most common travel time is during summer vacation, in July (40%) and August (45%)."  
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/27072

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Most domestic trips in Korea are relatively short, typically lasting three days or less.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Two-thirds of respondents plan a relatively short trip within 3 days (2–4 days, 3%; 1-day trip, 1%, average 2.2 days)."  
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/27072

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: The most frequently planned domestic travel destinations in Korea are江原道 (Gangwon Province), Jeju Island, and Busan.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Planned regions to visit include Gangwon Province (34%), Jeju Island (26%), and Busan (20%)."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/27072

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Koreans prefer domestic travel because it is convenient, close in distance, and allows for relaxation in a comfortable environment.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Many cited relatively low difficulty in traveling, such as 'because travel is convenient (61%)', 'because travel time is short and distance is close (41%)', 'able to relax in a comfortable atmosphere (42%)' as main reasons."  
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/27072

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: When traveling domestically, Koreans commonly engage in dining at good restaurants, sightseeing, visiting local specialty shops, and resting at accommodations like hotels.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Main activities include going to good restaurants (50%), enjoying scenery (40%), visiting local specialty shops (32%), and 30% said they would rest at accommodations such as hotel stays."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/27072

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Koreans primarily expect relaxation and freedom from domestic travel.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "85% of people believe they can 'get sufficient rest and recharge' and 'feel free' through domestic travel."  
  - Location paragraph 12===from https://hrcopinion.co.kr/archives/27072

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean travelers tend to meticulously plan and pre-book all aspects of their trips, often using detailed schedules (e.g., Excel files) to organize destinations, transportation, and time allocations, especially in group travel.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "숙소와 프로그램은 모두 예약하는 게 기본이다. 4인 이상 그룹 여행쯤 되면 엑셀 파일이 등장한다. VIP 의전이라도 하듯 시간대별 목적지, 이동 방법, 소요 시간을 상세히 기록해서 공유한다."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.vogue.co.kr/2024/03/14/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%B8%EC%9D%98-%EC%97%AC%ED%96%89%EB%B2%95/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean travelers commonly bring specific Korean food items (like gochujang tubes and instant noodles) and personal hygiene products (such as face masks and portable water filters), even when these are available locally, due to high personal hygiene standards.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "한국인의 커다란 트렁크에는 높은 확률로 고추장 튜브, 커플라면, 마스크 팩이 들어 있다... 속옷 손빨래용 접이식 실리콘 대야, 브리타 정수기를 가져오는 사람까지 있을 정도다."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.vogue.co.kr/2024/03/14/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%B8%EC%9D%98-%EC%97%AC%ED%96%89%EB%B2%95/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean travelers often avoid eye contact and interaction with other Koreans abroad, displaying heightened sensitivity to social evaluation, especially among couples who strongly signal privacy preferences.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "한국인끼리는 우연히 마주치면 필사적으로 시선을 외면한다... 이성 커플이면 특히 ‘가까이 오지 마. 우리 말 엿듣지도 마’라는 텔레파시가 강하게 발산된다."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.vogue.co.kr/2024/03/14/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%B8%EC%9D%98-%EC%97%AC%ED%96%89%EB%B2%95/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean travelers generally show less environmental consciousness than Western travelers, such as frequently purchasing small single-use plastic water bottles and lacking awareness of reef-safe sunscreen labels.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "유럽 여행자들이 일회용 플라스틱 사용을 줄여보려고 물통을 지참하거나 대용량 생수를 구입해서 들고 다닐 때 한국 여행자들은 망설임 없이 자그마한 생수를 구입한다... 선블록의 ‘리프 프리’라든가 ‘코럴 프리’ 마크가 무엇을 뜻하는지 모르는 사람도 많다."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://www.vogue.co.kr/2024/03/14/%ED%95%9C%EA%B5%AD%EC%9D%B8%EC%9D%98-%EC%97%AC%ED%96%89%EB%B2%95/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Bathing in Korea is not just about personal hygiene but also serves as a social activity where people interact, exchange news, and build relationships.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "한국의 공중목욕탕은 단순히 몸을 씻는 공간을 넘어 사람들 간의 교류가 이루어지는 공동체의 중심이었습니다."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://tistory2025.tistory.com/27

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Public bathhouses in Korea have separate areas for men and women, reflecting a cultural norm in communal bathing spaces.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "단서로 들어가면 남녀 탈의실이 따로 있고, 목욕 공간도 성별에 따라 구분되어 있습니다." (Note This sentence is not present in the provided text.)
  - Location Not available

> Note After careful review, there is no explicit mention of gender segregation or any specific rule about modesty, nudity, or mixed-gender use in the provided text. Therefore, this characteristic cannot be included based on the evidence.===from https://tistory2025.tistory.com/27

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Bathing and steaming practices in Korean bathhouses are valued for their health benefits, such as relieving fatigue and improving blood circulation.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "불가마(뜨겁게 달궈진 방)와 한증막(찜질방 내 증기실)은 몸의 피로를 풀고 혈액순환을 돕는 효과가 있습니다."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://tistory2025.tistory.com/27

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Bathhouses and jjimjilbangs are commonly visited by families, friends, and couples, indicating that these spaces are culturally accepted and designed for group use across generations.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "찜질방은 온 가족이 함께 방문하기 좋은 공간으로 자리 잡았습니다. 아이들은 놀이방에서 놀고, 어른들은 편안한 공간에서 휴식을 취하며, 친구들과 연인들도 부담 없이 함께 즐길 수 있는 장소입니다."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://tistory2025.tistory.com/27

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: It is customary to consume specific foods like baked eggs and sikhye (sweet rice beverage) after bathing or steaming in a jjimjilbang.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "찜질방을 방문하면 꼭 먹어야 할 간식이 있습니다. 바로 구운 계란과 식혜입니다."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://tistory2025.tistory.com/27

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: In ancient Korea, bathing was regarded as a sacred act to cleanse sins, particularly observed during the traditional ritual on the third day of the third lunar month (Samjinnal).
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "첫 목욕에 관한 기록은 삼국 시대로 거슬러 올라간다. 음력 3월 3일 삼짇날에 행하는 '계옥'이라는 목욕 풍습과 삼국유사 속 기록에서 선조들은 목욕을 죄를 씻는 성스러운 행위로 여겼음이 드러난다."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.hankyung.com/article/202503078142i

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: During the Goryeo period, people of all ages and genders commonly bathed together in streams, reflecting a communal approach to bathing.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "고려시대에는 남녀노소가 한데 모여 함께 개울에서 목욕을 즐겼다."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.hankyung.com/article/202503078142i

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: During the Joseon period, influenced by Neo-Confucianism, bathing became a private and solemn activity rather than a communal or recreational one.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "반면 성리학이 지배한 조선시대에는 목욕이 사적이고 경건한 행위였다."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.hankyung.com/article/202503078142i

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: In modern Korea, public bathhouses (mogyoktang) and jjimjilbang (Korean sauna) evolved into social spaces where neighbors meet, and jjimjilbang specifically became places for families and friends to eat and spend time together.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "대중목욕탕과 찜질방은 동네 사람들이 만나는 소통의 장이 됐고 찜질방은 단순히 땀을 빼러 가는 곳을 넘어 가족, 친구들과 함께 맛있는 음식을 먹으며 노는 공간이 됐다."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.hankyung.com/article/202503078142i

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Due to urbanization and improved household sanitation infrastructure, there has been a cultural shift from communal bathing toward individualized services such as private rooms offering massage and skincare.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "상하수도 시설이 깔리고 현대식 아파트가 들어서면서 가정집에도 욕조가 보급되자 대중목욕탕의 역할은 점점 축소됐다. 특히 펜데믹을 기점으로 대중목욕탕 수는 급감했고, 목욕부터 마사지와 피부관리까지 제공하는 고급 1인 관리실이 늘어났다."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.hankyung.com/article/202503078142i

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Visiting public bathhouses was not only for personal hygiene but also served as a regular social event, especially during the 1970s to early 1980s in Korea.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Scrubbing down with a so-called 'Italy towel,' covered in clouds of steam, was more than a mere visit to clean the body — it was a social event for many."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2025-03-20/culture/koreanHeritage/The-History-of-Washing-explores-bathing-culture-in-Korea/2266378

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: The practice of intense exfoliation using coarse towels emerged because people bathed infrequently and needed to remove accumulated dirt from weeks of unwashed skin.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "That’s how Korea’s famous scrubbing culture emerged,” Lee said. “If people could bathe daily, there would be no need for such intense exfoliation."
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2025-03-20/culture/koreanHeritage/The-History-of-Washing-explores-bathing-culture-in-Korea/2266378

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Koreans use coarse cloths known as "Italy towels" to scrub off dead skin cells during bathing.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "So-called Italy towels are coarse cloth used by Koreans to scrub off dead skin cells."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2025-03-20/culture/koreanHeritage/The-History-of-Washing-explores-bathing-culture-in-Korea/2266378

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Trained professionals known as sesinsa provide deep-cleaning exfoliation services in bathhouses, a practice that became established in the late 1960s.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Around the same time, the professional bath scrubbers known as sesinsa emerged as a profession, offering deep-cleaning services to those willing to pay for them."
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2025-03-20/culture/koreanHeritage/The-History-of-Washing-explores-bathing-culture-in-Korea/2266378

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: The widespread availability of private bathrooms and home bathing facilities has reduced the need for communal bathhouses, shifting bathing from a shared to a private activity.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Bathtubs and showers at home have now negated the need for communal bathing..."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2025-03-20/culture/koreanHeritage/The-History-of-Washing-explores-bathing-culture-in-Korea/2266378

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Concerns about hygiene during the Covid-19 pandemic have led many Koreans to avoid public bathhouses and similar shared spaces like jjimjilbang.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "The Covid-19 pandemic dealt another blow to communal bathing culture. Increased public concern over hygiene and shared spaces has led many Koreans to avoid public bathhouses, as well as their close relative, the Korean-style sauna known as jjimjilbang."
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2025-03-20/culture/koreanHeritage/The-History-of-Washing-explores-bathing-culture-in-Korea/2266378

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Public bathhouses remain a vital resource for low-income seniors and individuals living alone who lack proper bathing facilities at home.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "For those who lack proper bathing infrastructure, bathhouses remain a vital resource,” she said. “We need to think about how we can preserve them, not just as a relic of the past, but as an essential part of public welfare.”
  - Location paragraph 13===from https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/2025-03-20/culture/koreanHeritage/The-History-of-Washing-explores-bathing-culture-in-Korea/2266378

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: In Korea, public bathhouses (대중 목욕탕) historically served as communal spaces for maintaining public hygiene and fostering community bonding, especially before households had private bathing facilities.

  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.earticle.net/Public/Articles/5/2526/3962?issue=363542

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean SNS users place relatively higher importance on self-enhancement, uncertainty avoidance, and long-term orientation values compared to Chinese users.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "The findings showed that uncertainty avoidance, long-term orientation and self enhancement were regarded higher by Korean users, whereas openness-to-change, collectivism and masculinity received more importance by Chinese users."
  - Location paragraph 5===from http://journal.dcs.or.kr/_PR/view/?aidx=28048&bidx=2471

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean SNS users show significantly higher motivation for entertainment through SNS compared to Chinese users.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Next, Korean and Chinese SNS users were compared, and the results showed that Koreans had higher entertainment-seeking motivation (F=4.74, ρ<.05)."
  - Location paragraph 19===from http://journal.dcs.or.kr/_PR/view/?aidx=28048&bidx=2471

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean SNS users exhibit lower tendencies to avoid SNS advertisements compared to Chinese users, indicating greater acceptance.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Next, regarding SNS ad avoidance, Chinese = 4.92, Korean = 4.48, showing that Chinese users have a higher tendency to avoid SNS ads than Koreans (F=18.72, ρ<.01)."
  - Location paragraph 20===from http://journal.dcs.or.kr/_PR/view/?aidx=28048&bidx=2471

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean SNS users are more active in delivering opinions (a key form of online word-of-mouth) compared to Chinese users.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "In terms of eWOM activities, no differences were found between Korean and Chinese users in opinion seeking or opinion provision, but Koreans were more active in opinion delivery (F=5.60, ρ<.05)."
  - Location paragraph 20===from http://journal.dcs.or.kr/_PR/view/?aidx=28048&bidx=2471

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: For both Korean and Chinese users, the motive of status enhancement plays the most prominent role in influencing SNS ad acceptance and eWOM behaviors.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "Next, openness-to-change and self enhancement exerted the greatest impact on SNS usage motives in both Korean and Chinese users, and status enhancement motive for SNS usage played the most salient role in SNS ad acceptance and eWOM."
  - Location paragraph 5===from http://journal.dcs.or.kr/_PR/view/?aidx=28048&bidx=2471

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: 중매혼은 부모나 가문의 의사에 따라 이루어지는 전통적 혼인 방식으로, 조선시대부터 유교적 영향 아래 널리 보급되었으며, 혼인 결정권은 가장이 가지고 중매인이 양가 간의 의견을 조정하는 역할을 한다.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "중매혼은 혼인 당사자의 의지보다 부모나 가문의 의사에 따라 이루어지는 혼인을 말하며, 조선시대 이래 유교식 가례(家禮)의 영향으로 널리 보급되어 전통사회의 전형적 혼인유형으로 자리잡게 되었다."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0063911

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: 중매혼 과정에서는 어머니가 중요한 역할을 하지만 최종 결정은 아버지가 하며, 대종가의 종손일 경우 문중 회의를 통해 혼사가 결정되기도 한다. 또한 궁합은 혼인 결정에 큰 영향을 미치는 요소로 과거뿐 아니라 현재에도 상당한 영향력을 지닌다.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "중매혼 과정에서는 어머니가 큰 구실을 하지만, 최종결정은 혼인당사자의 아버지가 내린다. 특히 대종가(大宗家)의 종손일 경우 문중 회의를 열어 혼사를 결정하기도 한다. 중매혼의 경우 혼인을 결정함에 큰 영향을 미치는 것으로 궁합(宮合)이 있다. 궁합은 과거에 매우 중요시되었을 뿐만 아니라 오늘날에도 상당한 영향을 미치고 있다."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0063911

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: 중매인은 정보중매인, 정식중매인, 기타중매인의 세 가지로 나뉘며, 각각 여자들의 외부출입을 제한받던 시기에 정보를 제공하거나, 양가의 의사 조정 및 문서 교환을 담당하거나, 신임받는 인물이나 근친을 통해 상대방에 대한 정확한 정보를 수집하는 역할을 수행한다.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "중매인은 다음 세 종류로 나눌 수 있다. 첫째 정보중매인이다... 둘째 정식중매인이다... 셋째 기타중매인이다."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0063911

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: 중매혼에는 선을 보는 과정이 포함되며, 과거에는 신랑이 동행하지 않고 어머니와 근친 여성들이 여자 집에 가서 규수를 만나는 형식이 주를 이루었으나, 오늘날에는 남녀 당사자가 직접 맞선을 보는 경우가 많다.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "중매혼에는 선을 보는 과정이 수반되는데, 과거에는 신랑될 남자가 동행하지 않고 신랑의 어머니와 근친의 여자들이 여자집에 가서 규수를 직접 만나보는 형식이 주를 이루었고, 오늘날은 남녀가 맞선을 보는 경우가 많다."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0063911

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: 연애혼은 혼인 당사자가 자유롭게 배우자를 선택하고 사랑을 기반으로 결혼하는 형태로, 조선시대에 사라졌다가 1920년대 식민지 시대 신여성을 중심으로 유행한 이후 현대 사회에서 주류 혼인 유형이 되었다.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "연애혼은 근대 서구사조의 영향으로 도입된 것이란 인식이 지배적이나, 신라시대에 이미 상류사회를 중심으로 연애혼을 행한 흔적이 남아 있다... 연애혼은 조선시대에 유교적 규범이 도입되면서 자취를 감추다가 1920년대 식민지 시대 신여성을 중심으로 연애혼이 유행된 이후 현대사회로 들어서면서는 주류를 이루는 혼인유형이 되고 있다."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0063911

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: 현대 한국 사회로 접어들면서 중매혼의 비율은 감소하고 연애혼의 비율은 증가하는 추세를 보이며, 1981년부터 1989년까지의 통계에 따르면 중매혼은 58.4%에서 39.4%로 감소하고, 연애혼은 36.3%에서 54.7%로 증가하였다.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "분명한 건 전반적으로 중매혼의 비율은 감소하는 대신 연애혼의 비율은 증가 추세를 보이고 있다는 점이다. 1981년∼1989년 통계청 조사에 따르면 중매혼은 58.4%에서 39.4%로 감소한 대신 연애혼은 36.3%에서 54.7%로 증가하였음을 볼 수 있다."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0063911

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: 배우자 선택에서 부모의 영향력은 점차 약화되고 당사자의 권리가 강화되는 가운데, 전적으로 부모의 의사에 따르거나 부모가 정한 후 당사자가 동의하는 방식은 크게 줄어들었으며, 당사자가 정한 후 부모가 승낙하는 방식이 가장 선호되는 형태로 자리 잡았다.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "곧 1950년대 조사에서는 배우자 결정 시 ‘전적으로 부모님의 의사에 따른다’는 비율이 11.5%로 나타났으나, 1980년대 이후 2000년대 조사에서는 그 비율이 1.6%∼0%로 거의 나타나지 않고 있다... 반면 ‘당사자가 정한 후 부모님이 승낙한다’는 방식은 1970년대 이후부터 가장 선호하는 배우자 선택 방식으로 부상했다."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://encykorea.aks.ac.kr/Article/E0063911

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.feature: Korean weddings often involve a hybrid format where Western-style ceremonies are held first, followed by traditional Korean rituals such as bowing to the groom’s parents (pyebaek) in hanbok within an ondol room.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Daily life a.original:
- Quoted text "오늘날 ‘결혼식’ 하면 자연스럽게 떠올리는, 결혼예식장에서 서양식 예복을 입은 두 사람이 주례자 앞에서 본식을 치르고 난 뒤에 온돌방에서 한복을 입고 폐백을 드리는 풍경은 가만히 생각해보면 전통과 현대, 동양과 서양이 뒤섞인 묘하고 특이한 광경이다."  
  - Location paragraph 4  

---
